Name_3: Face Off: Is Hong Kong losing its status as a global financial hub?
Text_3:
If you are interested in joining future Face Off debates fill out this form to submit your application.

Yes Hong Kong will lose its status because of its travel restrictions

Sheryl Law 11 Holy Angels Canossian School

Photo: Handout

Hong Kong‚Äôs strict Covid-19 prevention strategies have driven foreign businesses away. According to a survey by the city‚Äôs European Chamber of Commerce nearly 50 per cent of European companies are planning to move out of Hong Kong.

What‚Äôs more many people are debating whether Hong Kong will lose its status as an international financial hub. I think it will unless the government drops its travel restrictions soon.

Most countries have decided to ‚Äúlive with the virus‚Äù with people not needing to wear masks even when they go out. But Hong Kong thinks differently and that is hurting us. Under the city‚Äôs ‚Äú3+4‚Äù model travellers must undergo three days of compulsory quarantine at a designated hotel followed by four days of ‚Äúmedical surveillance‚Äù at home. Besides they will be tested for Covid-19 daily during that period. This is very troublesome so most tourists avoid Hong Kong. Also many major international events in the city have been cancelled.

New border channel for Hong Kong students heading to mainland China

Some people may think Hong Kong‚Äôs Covid-19 curbs are not a problem because of the development of technology. However face-to-face gatherings are different from online meetings. We are not robots. Humans need interaction with their fellow professionals and business partners. A majority of students prefer having physical lessons instead of online classes. I believe it is the same in the adult world.

Hong Kong‚Äôs quarantine restrictions have led to a lull in investments in the city and an exodus of talent across financial and many other industries.

With countries such as Canada Britain and Australia opening up new immigration pathways for Hongkongers many young skilled professionals as well as wealthy families are planning to leave their hometown.

Education Bureau rejects survival plans by 2 under-enrolled secondary schools

A total of 140500 Hongkongers had applied for Britain‚Äôs BN(O) programme up to June this year and 95 per cent ‚Äì 133124 people ‚Äì had been approved. This allows successful applicants and their dependents to live work and study in Britain for up to five years after which they can apply for citizenship.

Also thousands of students have left Hong Kong to study abroad. Teachers are leaving too. I fear for the city‚Äôs future.

Hong Kong needs a concrete plan for ending its quarantine requirements if it is to reconnect with the rest of the world retain key talent and maintain its competitive edge as an international financial centre.

No the Hong Kong market is stable and can withstand shocks

Calissa Poon 11 Diocesan Girls‚Äô Junior School

Photo: Handout

Some believe that China‚Äôs overhaul of Hong Kong‚Äôs political system coupled with the strict Covid-19 restrictions means the end of the city‚Äôs status as an international financial hub. Yet more than two years after the introduction of the national security law and with the ongoing pandemic Hong Kong is still a regional hub for international business attracting people from all corners of the globe.

Hong Kong remained third in the Global Financial Centres Index after New York and London even as a series of measures to combat the spread of the coronavirus weighed on the city‚Äôs economy.

A Hong Kong government spokesman noted the city‚Äôs financial markets have continued to function ‚Äúin an orderly manner‚Äù despite uncertainties from the Covid-19 pandemic. Major global banks and financial institutions including BlackRock and Citigroup remain dominant players in the city. These are signs that the city continues to make progress amid turbulent times.

Face Off: Will a vaccine pass be effective in containing Covid-19?

Hong Kong‚Äôs status as a global financial centre has been enhanced since the handover because it is now acting as a bridge between mainland China and the rest of the world.

Beijing‚Äôs support is also providing Hong Kong with fresh opportunities to further boost its reputation. Hong Kong can take advantage of the development of the Greater Bay Area (GBA) where new foreign enterprises and talent will be based. The GBA comprises Hong Kong Macau and nine municipalities on the mainland.

While Hong Kong has made good progress it has not always been plain sailing. The city was rocked by the 2019 anti-government protests and now the pandemic.

Hong Kong students head back to school as Covid-19 cases surge

But the Hong Kong market is stable because global investors are confident about its ability to withstand shocks. Hong Kong offers many advantages ‚Äì it has no capital controls while a fully convertible currency and solid infrastructure make it a top attraction.

Even though Hong Kong is now a part of China the city will still be a top destination for foreign businesses. Being an international financial hub is less about politics and more about efficient management so there is no doubt that Hong Kong is still No 1 in the region.

From what I have seen Hong Kong will remain one of the world‚Äôs leading financial centres for years to come.

Name: Dollar General
Name_1: Rural crews battle fire at Dollar General in Wilson County
Text_1:
Crews were fighting a fire at a Dollar General in Wilson County early Saturday morning.

The fire which is at 219 Moyton Avenue is about 15 miles outside of Wilson's city limits.

Only rural fire departments are on the scene with at least 5 county fire departments responding. According to officials it took around an hour for the fire to be extinguished and the flames caused severe damage.

The Wilson County Sheriff Office is also assisting.

This is a breaking story. More details will be added as they become available.
Name_2: What happened to 2 dollar bills?
Text_2:
New York CNN Business ‚Äî

Inflation has made it hard to buy much with a buck these days.

$1 pizza has disappeared. Dollar stores aren‚Äôt dollar stores anymore.

So wouldn‚Äôt it make more sense to start paying with $2 bills instead?

‚ÄúIf you had a $2 bill perfect‚Äù said Heather McCabe a writer and $2 bill evangelist who runs the blog Two Buckaroo chronicling her spending with twos and other people‚Äôs reactions. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a very useful thing to pay for a small amount.‚Äù

Yet the $2 note is the unloved child of paper currency.

It‚Äôs considered a curiosity to some and scorned by others in the United States. The myths around the $2 bill ‚Äî nicknamed ‚ÄúTom‚Äù by fans because it features Thomas Jefferson‚Äôs portrait on the front ‚Äî are endless. Many Americans think $2 bills are rare are not printed anymore or have gone out of circulation.

Wrong.

$2 bills are lighter to carry around in our wallets than ones cleaner and more efficient. MediaNews Group/Reading Eagle/Getty Images

The Treasury Department‚Äôs Bureau of Engraving and Printing (BEP) will print up to 204 million $2 bills this year based on an annual order from the Federal Reserve System. There were 1.4 billion $2 bills in circulation in 2020 according to the latest data from the Federal Reserve.

But $2 bills account for just 0.001% of the value of the $2 trillion worth of currency in circulation.

BEP doesn‚Äôt have to request new $2 bills each year like it does for other bills. That‚Äôs because $2 bills are used so infrequently and last longer in circulation. The Fed orders them every few years and works down the inventory.

‚ÄúMany Americans have pretty dubious assumptions about the $2 bill. Nothing happened to the $2 bill. It‚Äôs still being made. It‚Äôs being circulated‚Äù McCabe said. ‚ÄúAmericans misunderstand their own currency to the extent they don‚Äôt use it.‚Äù

Bad luck

The United States first issued $2 bills beginning in 1862 around the time the federal government first started printing paper money. Alexander Hamilton‚Äôs portrait was on the two until a new series was printed in 1869 with Jefferson.

But the deuce was unpopular and never gained a foothold with the public.

A major reason: The the $2 bill was considered bad luck. Superstitious people would rip off the corners of the bill to ‚Äúreverse the curse‚Äù making the bills unfit to use.

‚ÄúHe who sits in a game of chance with a two-dollar bill in his pocket is thought to be saddled with a jinx‚Äù the New York Times said in a 1925 article. ‚ÄúThey have been avoided as ill-starred.‚Äù

The two was also known for keeping controversial company. It was associated with gambling where it was the standard bet at racetracks and prostitution.

And during the nineteenth century crony candidates frequently used $2 bills to bribe voters. Someone holding a $2 bill was thought to have sold a vote to a crooked politician.

The Treasury Department during the 1900s tried unsuccessfully several times to popularize the use of the $2 bill. In 1966 it gave up and discontinued printing the bills ‚Äúbecause a lack of public demand.‚Äù

But a decade later as the United States approached the bicentennial the Treasury designed a new $2 bill series with a portrait of the signing of the Declaration of Independence on the back.

The aim was to cut the number of $1 bills in circulation and save the Treasury money on production costs.

But the relaunch in 1976 failed. People viewed the new version as a collector‚Äôs item and hoarded them instead of going out and spending them.

The Postal Service offered to stamp them only on April 13 the first day they were issued in honor of Jefferson‚Äôs birthday unintentionally adding to the idea that they were commemorative bills -‚Äî a misconception that continues to this day.

‚ÄúThe press and public now tend to link the $2 bill with the Susan B. Anthony dollar under the general heading of ‚Äòfiascos‚Äô‚Äù the New York Times said in 1981.

There‚Äôs no rational reason why $2 bills aren‚Äôt as popular as other bills said Paolo Pasquariello a professor of finance at the University of Michigan. But people exhibit a preference for multiples of 1 and 5 he said.

Another reason $2 bills never took off: Cash registers invented in the late 1800s were never designed with a place to hold them so cashiers didn‚Äôt know where to stash them.

‚ÄúThere wasn‚Äôt an alteration of cash registers for $2 bills‚Äù said Heather McCabe. ‚ÄúThe infrastructure of paying for things didn‚Äôt change. There was not an adjustment of how people work with that bill.‚Äù

If cash registers had a familiar slot for $2 bills the bill would be more popular she argued.

$2 subculture

But there are people who swear by $2 bills. In fact communities and subcultures have developed around them.

US Air Force pilots who fly U-2 spy planes always keep a $2 bill in their flight suits.

Since the 1970s fans of Clemson University‚Äôs Tigers football team have paid and tipped with $2 bills -‚Äî ‚ÄúTiger Twos‚Äù ‚Äî in other cities‚Äô restaurants bars shops and hotels. The tradition started as a way to prove to Georgia Tech in Atlanta that it would benefit the city to schedule games against Clemson.

‚ÄúThere is a degree of popularity to them. There is a sense of excitement‚Äù said Jesse Kraft a curator at the American Numismatic Society. ‚ÄúBut as far as putting them back into circulation that‚Äôs the key that‚Äôs missing.‚Äù

Kraft is a proponent of adopting $2 bills more widely.

Clemson fans mark their "Tiger Two's" with orange paws from a stamp pad and spend them to give businesses on the road the idea of their economic impact. Ken Ruinard/The Greenville News/USA Today Network

He notes that it‚Äôs about half as expensive for the Treasury to print a $2 bill than higher denominations which come with costlier security features on the paper. It‚Äôs also more efficient to print $2 bills than $1 bills because the Treasury can print twice as much for the same amount of money and requires less storage.

John Bennardo who made a 2015 film about $2 bills called ‚ÄúThe Two Dollar Bill Documentary‚Äù has made it his mission to ‚Äúeducate people and enlighten them and start using $2 bills in their life.‚Äù

In short he concludes $2 bills are underappreciated in the United States and a way for strangers to meet and engage.

‚ÄúYou will get remembered if you use a $2 bill‚Äù Bennardo said. ‚ÄúIt has this ability to connect people in way that other bills don‚Äôt. It opens up a dialogue between you and the cashier.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a practical bill with inflation. But it‚Äôs social currency as well.‚Äù
Name_3: Picture Rocks to get public bus service for first time
Text_3:
For the first time Sun Shuttle will expand its services and provide public transportation to the Picture Rocks area.

The one-year pilot program will launch on Oct. 24 a news release from Sun Shuttle said. Since at least 14% of the Picture Rocks population has unmet transportation needs community members have spoken up about the importance of public transportation to provide access to social services medical services and employment opportunities.

‚ÄúThe Regional Transportation Authority has listened to residents of Picture Rocks and their call for public transportation‚Äù RTA Executive Director Farhad Moghimi said in the news release. ‚ÄúWe are interested in working with the community through this pilot project to test the interest in using Sun Shuttle. We encourage residents to provide their input at the upcoming meeting to be part of the process to deliver the best possible service to the community.‚Äù

The pilot program will provide service to destinations such as the park-and-ride at the local Dollar General Safeway the Tucson Premium Outlets and connection points to additional transit routes.

‚ÄúThis pilot program is part of our ongoing commitment to providing quality transit service throughout southern Arizona‚Äù Moghimi said. ‚ÄúThe shuttle service will be open to anyone and will be a great time to try this neighborhood transit option.‚Äù

Program managers will use the pilot program to assess the success of the service and evaluate how to best serve the area after the year-long pilot the news release said. The transit fares for the service will remain free through Dec. 31.

Community members are encouraged to attend an input meeting on Monday Sept. 19 as transit planners are working out the schedule and frequency of the new service and need help from the public. The meeting will be from 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. at the Picture Rocks Community Center located at 5615 N. Sanders Road.
Name_4: Elderly man killed in crash in Jefferson Davis Parish
Text_4:
Louisiana State Police:

Driver Killed in Multi-Vehicle Crash in Jefferson Davis Parish

Jefferson Davis Parish ‚Äì On September 17 2022 shortly after 12:00 p.m. Louisiana State Police Troop D was notified of a three-vehicle fatal crash on LA Hwy 26 about a half mile south of LA Hwy 102 in Jefferson Davis Parish.

The crash claimed the life of 75-year-old Larry Andrew Doucett of Hathaway.

The preliminary investigation revealed a 2005 International DuraStar (Forestry Bucket Truck) driven by 40-year-old Alfredo Guilamo of Katy Texas was traveling south on LA 26.

At the same time the driver of a 2017 Hyundai Accent stopped for traffic that had stopped in front of him.

Guilamo failed to stop and traveled into the northbound lane of travel in an attempt to avoid striking the Hyundai.

As Guilamo steered to the left the right side fender of a portable wood chipper being towed struck the rear of the Hyundai.

After the initial impact with the Hyundai the bucket truck traveled into the driveway of Dollar General and struck the left side of a 1999 Chrysler Town and Country van being driven by Doucett.

Both vehicles entered a roadside ditch which caused the bucket truck to overturn and come to rest on top of the Chrysler.

Despite being properly restrained Doucett sustained fatal injuries and was pronounced dead at the scene.

The front seat passenger in the Chrysler who was properly restrained sustained serious injuries and was transported to area hospital for treatment.

The driver of the Hyundai and his passenger were both properly restrained and not injured. Guilamo was properly restrained and not injured.

Toxicology samples were obtained and will be submitted for analysis. This crash remains under investigation.

While this crash remains under investigation inattentive/distracted driving continues to be a leading factor in fatal crashes in our state.

More information on distracted driving can be found online at www.distraction.gov.

Troop D has investigated 18 fatal crashes resulting in 20 deaths in 2022.
Name_5: Unpaid Pa. Turnpike tolls are surging. 3 ways to force deadbeats to pay ‚Äî including keeping their tax refunds
Text_5:
The problem of unpaid Turnpike tolls is getting worse. Much worse.

Yet state lawmakers aren‚Äôt in a hurry to do anything about it. They don‚Äôt care that many honest drivers are being gouged with higher tolls to cover the tolls deadbeats don‚Äôt pay. Think about that when you go to the polls in November.

From April 2021 to March 2022 the Turnpike anticipated being stiffed for $155 million according to a recent report. That‚Äôs up from $104 million during the previous year.

The Turnpike Commission says the amount of uncollected tolls is rising because more people are using the toll road and because toll prices are rising. All the more reason to get tougher as toll increases are planned to occur annually for another 28 years.

Higher tolls are needed to pay off debt the Turnpike unfairly had to incur under a state law that diverts some Turnpike funds to PennDOT for road construction and transit.

Current toll collection efforts clearly are insufficient. Sure it‚Äôs a difficult problem to solve. But with a little creativity and a Draconian attitude progress can be made.

The Turnpike broke ground a few years ago by becoming the first toll agency in the nation to pursue criminal charges for theft. It needs to get even more aggressive on that front.

Legislation that could help in another way is halfway to the finish line. In May the state House unanimously passed a bill that would require PennDOT to suspend registrations of vehicles with at least four unpaid tolls or unpaid tolls totaling $250 or more in the last five years.

Current law sets a higher bar for suspensions: at least six unpaid tolls or unpaid tolls totaling at least $500 in the last three years.

If the legislation were in effect today nearly 24000 vehicles in Pennsylvania would become eligible to have their registrations suspended.

The state Senate fled Harrisburg for its insultingly long summer break without voting on the bill though. Senators return to session next week and must prioritize this.

The Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission anticipates a substantial increase in uncollected tolls from $104 million to $155 million.

Unfortunately even a registration suspension isn‚Äôt enough to motivate many deadbeats into paying.

An audit released a few weeks ago by the state auditor general said that as of April motorists with suspended registrations still owed more than $26 million in tolls and fees.

‚ÄúThe significant amount of uncollected tolls and fees reflects that the current legal mechanism of registration suspension may not have had the desired impact on collections‚Äù the audit said.

In other words many deadbeats don‚Äôt give a damn.

If they have no problem driving through a toll booth without paying and then ignoring bills and collections notices they likely don‚Äôt have a problem driving an unregistered vehicle either.

So let‚Äôs up the ante.

The auditor general offered several recommendations. Two have the most promise.

* Enact legislation to prohibit the transfer of a vehicle title if there are unpaid tolls associated with the vehicle. Ohio enacted a law to do that earlier this year.

That means deadbeats can‚Äôt sell their vehicle which means they probably can‚Äôt buy a new one.

* Enact legislation to allow lottery winnings and state tax refunds to be garnished to collect unpaid tolls. Many people look forward to their refund every year. The state should starting looking forward to it too.

Here‚Äôs a third option that I would add ‚Äî deduct unpaid tolls from unemployment compensation.

Harsh? Yep. Someone claiming unemployment probably is struggling. But they had their chance to pay what they owed when they were working. That‚Äôs the kind of tough attitude necessary to lick this problem and send a message that unpaid tolls will not be tolerated.

Uncollected tolls were expected to rise after the Turnpike Commission did away with toll collectors who accepted cash payments in 2020.

It can be particularly difficult to get out-of-state scofflaws to pay. Pennsylvania doesn‚Äôt have any power over them. Negotiations are occurring with neighboring states on reciprocity agreements where their home states would punish them. But so far only one agreement has been reached with Delaware. And it hasn‚Äôt been implemented.

The recent Turnpike report says 93.5% of tolls are collected with 86.7% paid automatically with E-ZPass. Those who don‚Äôt use E-ZPass are billed through the mail based on their license plate.

About 14% of all non-E-ZPass tolls cannot be collected because the license plate was not readable (faded not captured by cameras or blocked such as by a trailer or bike rack); or because an address could not be found or bills were returned undeliverable.

About another 35% of bills simply are ignored by the recipient for at least 150 days.

The Turnpike has been expanding options for people to pay their bills.

Earlier this year it signed an agreement with KUBRA Cash Payment Network so customers can pay in cash at stores including 7-Eleven CVS Dollar General Family Dollar Royal Farms Rutter‚Äôs Sheetz Speedway and Walgreens.

The commission said it plans to soon accept payment via QR Codes Apple Pay Google Pay Zelle Venmo and other digital platforms.

More options will be a convenience for some motorists. But more options won‚Äôt shake the payment out of the worst scofflaws because they don‚Äôt ever intend to pay. That‚Äôs why harsher collection efforts are necessary.

Morning Call columnist Paul Muschick can be reached at 610-820-6582 or paul.muschick@mcall.com

Name: Dollar Tree
Name_1: One injured after multi-car crash in Panama City Beach
Text_1:
PANAMA CITY BEACH Fla. (WJHG/WECP) - One person was reported to have minor injuries after a multi-car crash caused delays on Front Beach Road in Panama City Beach Saturday afternoon.

Florida Highway Patrol troopers said the incident happened around 2:45 p.m. They say a car was leaving the Everything A Dollar store parking lot near the intersection of Front Beach Road and Hinson Avenue.

FHP said a car was turning onto Front Beach Road but failed to yield to another car that had the right of way on the roadway. Troopers report the cars crashed and drifted over into the opposite lanes where they then crashed into another car.

One of the cars did catch on fire but troopers said only one of the drivers was taken to a local hospital with minor injuries. They said no other injuries were reported.

Bay County Sheriff‚Äôs deputies closed sections of Front Beach Road for safety precautions. We‚Äôre told firefighters arrived on the scene and were able to extinguish the fire.

Bay County Sheriff‚Äôs officials said the roadway was re-opened within a few hours after the crash.

Name_3: Here's Why Realty Income Is a No-Brainer Dividend Stock
Text_3:
This reliable business has withstood the test of time.

Investing in the stock market this year has been a roller coaster ride for investors. High inflation and rapidly rising interest rates have weighed on asset prices. The latest inflation numbers are out showing that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose by 8.3% from August last year -- higher than economists expected.

There's no telling where inflation or the economy will go in the coming months. However history tells us that quality companies that pay out dividends consistently can be an excellent source of income.

One no-brainer dividend stock you can buy today is Realty Income (O -0.16%) the real estate stock that pays investors a monthly dividend. Realty Income has a solid business that can weather economic storms -- here's why the company is so durable.

Realty Income's high occupancy rate makes its business dependable

Realty Income is a real estate investment trust (REIT) that acquires and manages properties using long-term lease agreements. It manages over 11000 properties with clients including CVS Health Walgreens Dollar General and Dollar Tree.

Realty Income uses a triple-net lease with clients which makes those clients responsible for taxes maintenance and insurance on the properties. This common practice in single-occupancy commercial real estate lowers tenant rents and reduces Realty Income's financial responsibility for the building. While this leasing model can be risky at the individual building level because of vacancy risk (it's either 100% or 0% occupied) Realty Income mitigates this risk by spreading it across thousands of properties. That and a majority of its biggest clients have an investment-grade credit rating.

What makes Realty Income special is its high occupancy levels on its properties for over 25 years now. Going back to 1998 Realty Income has had a median occupancy level of 98% -- outpacing other REITs in the S&P 500 whose median occupancy is 94% in that same time.

Here's how it selects its properties

Realty Income occupancy rates have stayed consistent through different economic conditions including the Great Recession in 2008 which weighed heavily on real estate and other assets. The REIT leverages its 53 years in the business and takes a measured approach to its lease agreements.

For one the initial lease term is longer than average with its initial term being over 10 years -- helping Realty generate more dependable cash flow over time by using a longer initial lease term. Another attractive feature is that nearly 86% of its leases have built-in rent escalators tied to inflation or fixed increases which can also make this an attractive inflation hedge.

Two Realty Income can leverage its vast array of data to analyze new or existing opportunities that look attractive. The company whittles down its investment opportunities by looking at long-term industry trends that show the businesses it leases to are sustainable. It also analyzes the geographies of its properties to ensure they have attractive characteristics like being near major metropolitan areas.

For example 85% of the population in the U.S. lives within three miles of the company's pharmacy clients CVS Health and Walgreens Boots Alliance. Walgreens plans to build 1000 doctor's offices by 2027 presenting an opportunity for Realty Income to grow as its clients grow.

A safe dividend stock you can count on

Realty Income concentrates 84% of its portfolio on retail properties. One way it manages this risk is by diversifying across industries. Its highest exposure is to grocery stores which generate 10.5% of its annualized rent followed by convenience stores (9.2%) and dollar stores (7.2%).

This diversification and its strict selection process all add up to Realty Income being a dividend stock you can trust. For 27 years Realty Income has increased its dividend payout to investors affirming its status as a Dividend Aristocrat. The company has a dividend payout ratio of 76.5% -- a conservative ratio that will allow it to maintain its dividend and have enough capital to finance future property acquisitions.

With its 4.4% dividend yield and monthly dividend payouts investors in search of passive income can't go wrong with Realty Income stock.
Name_4: Meet the children of Patagonia founder Yvon Chouinard
Text_4:
In the TV show Succession adult children duke it out to be the heir of their father‚Äôs media empire. But what if no one wanted to head the business to begin with? You‚Äôd likely have a less dramatic (or funny) show but you might be closer to the reality of the Chouinard family.

In a move that subverts the traditional ideas of how companies are run and how wealth is often distributed among the 1% in the U.S. 83-year-old Patagonia founder Yvon Chouinard announced this week that he and his family were redirecting their personal profits to the task of combating climate change. He has a reported net worth of $1.2 billion.

The Chouinards are transferring their gains and voting stock to a newly established non-profit organization Holdfast Collective and a new trust the Patagonia Purpose Trust which both aim to tackle climate change. The family isn‚Äôt stepping away from the $3 billion company altogether as they‚Äôre still making key decisions while overseeing the Patagonia Purpose Trust.

The Chouinard children‚ÄîFletcher and Claire‚Äîaren‚Äôt clamoring for the title of CEO instead shirking away from billionaire status. ‚ÄúIt was important to them that they were not seen as the financial beneficiaries‚Äù Patagonia CEO Ryan Gellert told The New York Times of Chouinard‚Äôs children. ‚ÄúThey felt very strongly about it. I know it can sound flippant but they really embody this notion that every billionaire is a policy failure.‚Äù

If Earth is the only shareholder of Patagonia these days and the beneficiaries are the children of the world instead of Chouinard‚Äôs own kids who are these would-be heirs giving up the reins? Much like their father Fletcher and Claire seem to have a tendency to not play by the stereotypical rulebook of the wealthy.

They tend to stay out of the limelight keeping a low profile and barely speaking to the press. Both work for Patagonia but have their own pursuits within the company. Here‚Äôs what we do know about them.

Fletcher Chouinard

A lack of interest in being a billionaire wasn‚Äôt the only thing that Chouinard passed on to his kids. While Fletcher didn‚Äôt inherit Patagonia he‚Äôs inherited his father‚Äôs passion for being an outdoorsman. He loves to surf and kiteboard‚Äîhe even has a surfing trip diary from a decade ago to prove it. In an interview with The Kiteboarder he talks about how his dad helped him get into kitesurfing adding that he was inspired by Yvon‚Äôs interest in expedition sea kayaking. Fletcher himself became a dad in 2018.

Fletcher heads up the more than 20-year-old company FCD Surfboards backed by Patagonia with the tagline: ‚ÄúWe build each surfboard like it‚Äôs our own.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not just owners or board members‚Äù Fletcher told The New Yorker in 2016 of he and his sister working for Patagonia. He was 41 at the time ‚ÄúWe have normal salaries‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúWe weren‚Äôt brought up to give a shit about money. Actually I think we were raised to be slightly embarrassed about it.‚Äù

When Fletcher does talk to the press it‚Äôs mostly about surfing. He‚Äôs said his passion for designing boards started in high school. ‚ÄúIt was addicting for me‚Äù he said of his surfing design experience. ‚ÄúEventually I lost interest in my major at college and jumped ship to shape full time.‚Äù

As a surfboard designer Fletcher has been ‚Äúinstrumental in bringing environmental awareness to the surfing industry‚Äù according to a 2007 profile from Business 2.0 Magazine. When asked about how to make surfboards green he told The Kiteboarder in 2018 that he was a little jaded about alternative material being the solution and that unless there‚Äôs a big breakthrough in the area the most environmentally-conscious thing to do is invest in a durable board.

‚ÄúEveryone has a footprint‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúEven if I carve a natural deadfall tree into a surfboard it‚Äôs still releasing CO 2 out of the wood‚Äîwe do our best to make a product that lasts a long time.‚Äù

Claire Chouinard

Claire proves to be even more elusive than her older brother with a minimal digital footprint. A glimmer of her personality shone at age 12 when she dyed her orange with Kool-Aid before a dinner with the Clinton family in 1992 a tale her father once told The New Yorker.

She took her artsy side to Otis College of Art and Design which she graduated from in 2006. Today she channels her creativity by working in the fashion side of Patagonia responsible for some of the brand‚Äôs designs. True to both the company and her family Claire is focused on the environment.

‚ÄúOur current creative director Claire Chouinard really sets the tone for inspiring us to whole-heartedly embrace our company‚Äôs statement of purpose: We are in business to save our home planet‚Äù Patagonia design director Carrie Childs said in an interview last year. ‚ÄúEvery creative decision every design choice is filtered through that overarching purpose.‚Äù

Claire was the co-designer for Patagonia‚Äôs Truth to Materials collection in 2014 a line that focused on ‚Äúresponsible manufacturing‚Äù and using the ‚Äúpurest materials.‚Äù ‚ÄúLet the materials shine in their own light. Don‚Äôt fight them; let them do what they naturally want to do‚Äù Claire said during the ad campaign.

Much like her brother Claire has expressed a vested interest in making sure Patagonia aligns with her morals. As she told The New Yorker in 2016 when she was 38 ‚ÄúIf the company became something I didn‚Äôt believe in or approve of I wouldn‚Äôt want to be here.‚Äù
Name_5: Hostess Halloween lineup: When will the spooky twinkies come out?...
Text_5:
scary sweets Hostess Halloween lineup: When will the spooky twinkies come out?

HOSTESS has been producing America's favorite sweets since the 1900s.

September marks the release of limited edition fall and Halloween-inspired treats by the iconic brand known for its Twinkies.

2 Hostess is taking scary treats very seriously this coming Halloween

When will the spooky twinkies come out?

Hostess has been gearing up for Halloween since the end of summer.

Spooky Twinkies have been available since August 29 2022 and are made of a chocolate sponge cake with regular creme filling.

Twinkie lovers can pick up a 2-pack of the sweet treat or a 10-count box to enjoy with friends if they are in the mood for sharing.

However the limited edition treats found within in dark and spooky packaging are only available through October 31 - so make sure to get your fix while supplies last.

Read More on Halloween SPOOKY SEASON I'm a DIY pro - 12 Dollar Tree projects get you ready for Fall & Halloween

What other treats are included in the Hostess Halloween lineup?

Spooky Twinkies aren't the only scary treats Hostess has lined up for this Halloween season.

The popular brand is also serving up Scarycake Cupcakes and Creepy Caramel Ding Dongs.

The limited edition Scarycakes are available in 2-packs or 8-count boxes and are made of chocolate cupcakes with a creamy filling topped with orange frosting and a chocolaty icing squiggle.

The limited edition Creepy Dongs are available in 10-count boxes and are made of fudge-covered cake filled with caramel creme.

All three of the Halloween Hostess treats are available until the end of October.

Does Hostess have any fall-flavored items?

Aside from Hostess' Halloween-themed treats the brand also has a number of fall-inspired sweets which rolled out on September 1.

2 Hostess fall-inspired sweet treat lineup Credit: Hostess

The three limited edition items include:

Iced Pumpkin Cupcakes: made of pumpkin flavored cake topped with cream cheese flavored icing and complete with the original Hostess cupcake squiggle.

Pumpkin Spice Twinkies: made of golden sponge cake and filled with pumpkin spice-flavored creme.

Caramel Crunch Donettes: mini donuts with a sweet and crunchy caramel coating.

These items will only be available until November 30.

Name: Dominion Energy
Name_1: A squirrel in a substation caused a power outage for over 10000 Virginians
Text_1:
CNN ‚Äî

A small creature caused a blackout in Virginia Beach last week: a wandering squirrel that made its way into the substation.

It happened around 8:45 a.m. on September 7 according to a tweet from Bonita Harris spokesperson for Dominion Energy which provides electricity in Virginia and other states.

The power outage affected over 10000 Virginians Harris said. Power was restored by around 10 a.m.

Harris told CNN that animals occasionally get stuck in the company‚Äôs substations despite efforts to keep them out.

‚ÄúDominion Energy has standard equipment in place to keep squirrels and other animals safe when near our equipment‚Äù Harris said. ‚ÄúThis equipment reduces the number of incidents greatly but sometimes determined little critters will still get in there.‚Äù

The squirrel did not survive the incident Harris said although sometimes animals receive a brief shock and go mostly unharmed.

Harris said workers quickly rerouted power to another source to keep as many customers‚Äô lights on as possible.
Name_2: Conder Elementary power outage forces e-learning on Monday | wltx.com
Text_2:
The school will be open at set times for picking up supplies and food.

Example video title will go here for this video

Example video title will go here for this video

COLUMBIA S.C. ‚Äî A Richland County elementary school is without power and will be moving to virtual learning on Monday after a line was cut over the weekend.

A spokesperson for the Richland Two School District said on Sunday that L.W. Conder Elementary School lost power over the weekend after a major electrical line was cut by contractors who were working at the school.

Repairs according to Dominion Energy won't be complete until sometime on Monday afternoon the school district said.

The plan for Monday is for neither students nor employees to report on Monday with an "asynchronous e-learning day" planned instead. The school district said both employees and parents will get an email later Sunday night with additional details. A text message will follow.

Name_4: Groundbreaking solar CEO brings affordable clean energy to inner-city DMV communities
Text_4:
Nestled in Brooklyn New York alongside her mom Avellar -- that‚Äôs where Kristal Hansley became what she calls a child of the community.



‚ÄúMy mom was a very prominent community organizer; she started the largest vegetable farm in Bushwick Brooklyn New York" Hansley described. "And it looks like I'm carrying on the baton as a community organizer and advocating for those who don't advocate for themselves.‚Äù

So like the plants on her mother‚Äôs Brooklyn farm Hansley embraced the strength of the sun.

RELATED |

She founded WeSolar on Juneteenth of 2020 and in the process became the first Black woman to launch a community solar company.

‚ÄúThere's not a lot of representation as far as women and also people of color" Hansley said. "95% of solar executives are white men. And a lot of the barriers that's associated with traditional rooftop solar excludes 80% of households in our country.‚Äù

Hansley moved to D.C. to attend Howard University and then following her graduation worked on Capitol Hill. It‚Äôs there she says she learned the realities of the legislative process and how she could use that knowledge to ensure that her community wasn‚Äôt being excluded.



‚ÄúI wanted to make sure that the legislation that's being passed actually reached those that need it the most which is traditionally marginalized groups and communities of color" she explained.

WeSolar partners with local utility providers to make solar more attainable in communities Hansley says may have felt forgotten in the past. In fact Hansley promises electric bill savings between 10-50% to middle to low-income DMV residents.

‚ÄúI really want to see more of my community sign up and take advantage of these programs" she said.

READ ALSO |

As Kristal breaks barriers in the energy sector she says she gets herenergy from the women who came before her -- and hopes the next generation will be able to expand on her work.



‚ÄúI'm here because giants paved the way for me and yes I do feel the responsibility of being the first Black woman in this space that my community" she said. "To make sure that not only am I a player in the space but I'm creating an opportunity for young girls and young boys that look like me to come behind me.‚Äù

To learn more about WeSolar and the money it could potentially save your family in energy costs

Name: Dominos
Name_1: Chris Jericho On Working With Nick Gage in AEW Recalls Dominos Pizza Cutter Controversy
Text_1:
Chris Jericho‚Äôs match with Nick Gage in AEW was memorable not just for the match but also the Dominos Pizza controversy and Jericho recently looked back on the whole thing. Jericho battled the GCW star as one of the ‚ÄúLabors of Jericho‚Äù during his feud with MJF and Gage‚Äôs use of a pizza cutter at an inopportune moment caused some controversy when the Dominos ad aired right after it.

Jericho talked about working with Gage during the latest episode of Talk is Jericho recounting how he learned a lot about the psychology of deathmatch wrestling from Gage. He also weighed in on the Dominos incident as well and you can see the highlights below:

On working with Nick Gage in AEW: ‚ÄúNick Gage again like ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know who this guy is but he‚Äôs f**king insane.‚Äô And then I asked Mox about him [and Moxley said] ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs a teddy bear‚Äô or something whatever he said. And I spoke to him a couple of times and he was super super-respectful. And that goes a long way with me. Like I meet a lot of guys in the business and as long as you have respect for the business I‚Äôm cool with you. I don‚Äôt care what you do. And when I met him he was so so respectful and really was happy to be there and was kind of ‚ÄòHey man I just wanna tell you like I‚Äôm a really big fan of yours and it‚Äôs really cool for me to be here. And it was like he just loves wrestling.‚Äô This is the path his wrestling took doesn‚Äôt mean he‚Äôs any less of a wrestler.‚Äù

On learning more about deathmatch wrestling at that time: ‚ÄúI really started learning the psychology of deathmatch wrestling. What possesses these guys to do this? I‚Äôm not one of these guys to be like [imitates Jim Cornette] ‚ÄòWell that‚Äôs f**king bulls**t. That bulls**t stupid mudshow wrestling!‚Äô I don‚Äôt look at it that way. I look at it ‚ÄòOkay there‚Äôs a market for this and these guys are really good at what they‚Äôre doing; how are they doing it?‚Äô

‚ÄúSo I really watched what he was doing. And I thought like ‚ÄòS**t man I‚Äôll do it! I‚Äôll do it.‚Äô There was a time there was a Chris Jericho time period where I would have went ‚ÄòI would never get hit with a light tube. That‚Äôs stupid! That‚Äôs not wrestling that‚Äôs bulls**t.‚Äô And once again take head out of ass Jericho. Does it fit the story? Yes. Does it fit the story of the match? Yes. Let‚Äôs do it.‚Äù

On the Dominos controversy: ‚ÄúThat was hilarious. So Nick wanted to do a pizza cutter that‚Äôs one of his gimmicks. So right out the gate he slices my arm with the pizza cutter I still have a scar there. And that gets people like ‚ÄòHoly s**t! This is real!‚Äô And then during the commercial break he starts slicing my forehead with the pizza cutter in picture-in-picture‚Ä¶ So right when Nick is carving my forehead with the pizza cutter there is a Dominos Pizza commercial where the guy is cutting the pizza with what? A pizza cutter! And apparently Dominos was furious.

‚ÄúAnd this was ‚ÄòAEW is gonna lose all their sponsors and this is it! This is the end of the line!‚Äô Nothing ever happened. I was like if I was the Dominos guy I would have filmed a Chris Jericho/Nick Gage commercial the next f**king day. I mean it‚Äôs right there! Pizza cutters Dominos it goes hand in hand!‚Äù

If you use any of the quotes in this article please credit Talk Is Jericho with a h/t to 411mania.com for the transcription.

Name_3: Bitey The T-Rex Toy Gets A Job At Domino's While Waiting For His Humans To Return.
Text_3:
Most parents have experienced that sinking feeling of knowing your child left an important item behind. Whether it‚Äôs a favorite stuffed teddy bear or a plastic action figure there will be no peace at home until your child is reunited with their favorite toy!

A Domino‚Äôs Pizza branch in New Zealand recently received a call about a dinosaur toy for this exact reason. When staff members realized they did indeed have ‚ÄúBitey‚Äù the T-Rex in their possession they decided to put him to work!

‚ÄúLast week one of our stores received a worried call asking to check if ‚ÄòBitey‚Äô the T-Rex had been left in the foyer after his family had picked up pizzas that evening‚Äù Domino‚Äôs New Zealand wrote on Facebook. ‚ÄúSure enough Bitey was there!‚Äù

They went on to say that it was almost closing time so they told Bitey‚Äôs family to pick him up tomorrow. That‚Äôs when Bitey rolled up his tiny sleeves and got to work! After getting his very own name tag he learned how to make some tasty pizza.

After getting saucy in the kitchen Bitey got a lesson on phone etiquette and taking orders from hungry customers. He wasn‚Äôt very good at dialing the phone on account of his short arms but he turned out to be terrific at making witty banter.

Like any good restaurant worker Bitey took on dishwashing duty that night. We love the cute little cardboard hat they crafted for him too!

After washing up it was back to making pizzas. It‚Äôs a good thing Bitey is made of plastic and doesn‚Äôt actually eat food or else those pizzas wouldn‚Äôt have lasted two minutes. As it is Bitey didn‚Äôt eat a bite!

The restaurant reported ‚Äú‚Ä¶ he was sent home with plenty of stories to tell about his first shift at Domino‚Äôs the next day.‚Äù

We love that this Domino‚Äôs crew took some time out of their night to have fun with this child‚Äôs toy. Bitey has our vote for employee of the month!
Name_4: I tried Domino's ¬£16.99 'Big Brekkie' pizza and it was not what I expected - review
Text_4:
I've always joked with my friends about how a breakfast pizza should be a thing so you can imagine my reaction when Domino's actually launched one.

The 'Big Brekkie' pizza launched this September and includes toppings such as sausage smoked bacon mushroom and tomatoes with a choice of either brown or tomato sauce depending on what you fancy. It seems like this particular pizza has divided Domino's fans so I wanted to see what it really tasted like.

I'm a huge fan of Domino's pizza so I had really high hopes for the new brekkie addition. I did have a few concerns though was it going to be greasy? Heavy? Would someone even want to eat this in the morning? Let's find out.

READ MORE:John Lewis selling 'autumnal' dress that's 'the comfiest' I've worn

The pizza

My local Domino's didn't open until 11am so I skipped breakfast and found myself very hungry by 12pm. I opted for a small pizza since I was on my own and didn't want to be left with loads of pizza if I didn't like it.

My 'Big Brekkie' pizza arrived fresh and smelt absolutely unreal. After toying between tomato or brown sauce I went for the classic tomato and I'm so glad I did.

In terms of aesthetics this pizza looked surprisingly good! It didn't appear out of the ordinary or weird and even the tomato sauce was applied on top in quite a neat fashion.

It included big thick slices of Cumberland sausage and smooth crispy bacon with just the right amount of sauce. The mushrooms were a little slimy but I wasn't expecting them to be perfect because mushrooms can be a hit and miss anyway.

(Image: Emily Sleight/ Liverpool ECHO)

As I took a bite I was surprised at how utterly light this pizza was. When you think of a breakfast pizza you think huge greasy and stodgy but this pizza did everything right.

There was no grease on the toppings and the tomato sauce didn't overpower the pizza which was what I was worried about. The dough was light and fluffy and honestly I can see why people would choose to have this for a weekend brekkie treat.

Don't get me wrong this definitely isn't something you could eat on a daily basis but on a hungover weekend or if you fancy something different it's a great option. The cheese also worked really well with the breakfast ingredients which I was also a little dubious so that's another tick from me.

One thing I will say is the price of this pizza was a little steep at ¬£16.99 for the small and ¬£21.99 for a large. In total with delivery I paid ¬£18.49 for a small pizza which seems rather expensive to me considering you can get a cooked breakfast at my local caf√© for just over a fiver.

I do know that with places like Domino's it's all about the convenience of the delivery and the brand itself though. Since the pizza was actually really good I can let that slide.

The verdict

The toppings were top quality the tomato sauce really complemented the ingredients and the dough was beautifully fresh. I was very impressed.

I'm still so surprised at how light this pizza was which is why I'd definitely order it again. There were so many delicious flavours on the pizza that weren't ruined by the sauce and I'm so glad about that.

One thing I will say though is that if you don't like mushrooms you might have to take them off because they were a tad slimy on my pizza - but personally that didn't bother me.

All I can say is well done for Domino's Pizza for creating this absolute gem of a pizza something that I've actually been wanting for a while and now I've got it. It lived up to my expectations and it's a winner for me.

Name_5: DOMINO'S HEINZ TOMATO KETCHUP AND HP SAUCE GET SAUCY TOGETHER WITH THE LAUNCH OF NEW BIG ...
Text_5:
Domino‚Äôs the nation‚Äôs best loved pizza company is getting saucy this September as the OG of piping hot pizza joins forces with the master of sauces ‚Äì Heinz to launch the sauciest pizza yet. Drizzled with lashings of either Heinz Tomato Ketchup or HP Sauce the question is‚Ä¶ are you red saucy or brown saucy?

Taking the classic breakfast from plate to pizza the limited-edition Big Brekkie is made with Domino‚Äôs signature fresh dough that‚Äôs hand-stretched and spoodled with vine-ripened tomato sauce before being loaded with pork sausage smoked bacon mushrooms and chunky chopped tomatoes ‚Äì sprinkled with a generous layer of 100% mozzarella cheese.

But that‚Äôs not all customers will be asked to make the ultimate decision‚Ä¶ are they team red or team brown? Whatever the choice Domino‚Äôs has it covered with either HP Sauce or Heinz Tomato Ketchup drizzled over a piping hot Big Brekkie when it comes fresh out of the oven.

This saucy creation has been specially produced by Domino‚Äôs team of innovative pizza chefs who worked hard to combine Ireland‚Äôs breakfast favourites into a delicious pizza balancing the taste perfectly. Each bite is packed with bursts of flavours made to pair perfectly with the tangy HP Sauce or the sweeter option of Heinz Tomato Ketchup. And as delicious as it is on its own for the ultimate food pairing grab the Big Brekkie pizza with a sumptuous side of potato wedges for the ultimate saucy feast.

Speaking on the launch Melanie Howe Secretary of Sauce said: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre so excited to launch our sauciest pizza yet in partnership with the master of sauces Heinz. It‚Äôs a real saucy beast and has been in the making for over a year to ensure we serve up breakfast icons only. Whether it‚Äôs HP Sauce or classic Heinz Tomato Ketchup that tickles your taste buds the Big Brekkie is guaranteed to turn up the steam and serve up all the saucy goodness!‚Äù

Chlo√© Schiltz from Kraft Heinz said: ‚ÄúLong has the nation debated on whether you put Heinz Tomato Ketchup or HP Sauce on your breakfast and we can‚Äôt wait to find out which of our sauces reigns supreme on Domino‚Äôs Big Brekkie pizza.‚Äù

The Big Brekkie pizza can be purchased as part of the Mega Deal for just ‚Ç¨25.99 you can avail of one large pizza two scrumptious sides and Domino‚Äôs delicious cookies.

The Big Brekkie pizza is available now to order online through the Domino‚Äôs app or from your nearest store. For more information head to www.dominos.ie

Name_3: Germany to Get Europe's Largest Advanced Recycling Plant
Text_3:
Mura Technology plans to construct what it‚Äôs calling Europe‚Äôs largest advanced recycling plant at Dow's B√∂hlen site in Germany. It is expected to be operational by 2025 and would deliver approximately 120 kilotons per annum (KTA) of advanced recycling capacity.

This and other planned units expected to be constructed in Europe and the United States would collectively add as much as 600 KTA of advanced recycling capacity by 2030. The facility in B√∂hlen would be the first in Germany.

The project also would make Dow the largest global consumer of circular feedstock for polyethylene production. This is the first facility to be located at a Dow site. The project is targeted for a final investment decision by the end of 2023.

‚ÄúThe project has a series of investments all the way along so by the end of 2023 all contracts are expected to be in place‚Äù Marc van den Biggelaar Advanced Recycling Director Dow EMEA & APAC told PlasticsToday.

While the companies did not release financial details Mura announced on June 1 that its partner KBR a science technology and engineering firm made a $100 million investment in Mura to develop multiple new projects worldwide to remove more than one million tons of plastic from global waste streams.

Process uses supercritical steam to convert plastics

As shown in the video Mura's Hydrothermal Plastic Recycling Solution (HydroPRS) advanced recycling process uses supercritical steam to convert most forms of plastics including historically non-recyclable flexible and multi-layer materials back into the original oils and chemicals from which they were made. These can be used to create new ‚Äúvirgin-equivalent‚Äù polyethylene-based products that can be used in multiple medical and automotive applications and even for food-contact packaging the company said.

With Mura's process the same material can be recycled repeatedly so it has the potential to eliminate single-use plastics and prevent them from going to landfills or being incinerated. Advanced recycling processes are expected to save approximately 1.5 tons of carbon dioxide per ton of plastic recycled compared with incineration the company said. The technology also reduces reliance on fossil-based feedstocks.

Advanced recycling is different from mechanical recycling which shreds only certain types of plastic for recycling.

First plant in UK expected to be operational in 2023

The planned facility in Germany builds on Dow's ongoing collaboration with Mura first announced in 2021 with an initial project to construct the world's first plant using Mura's HydroPRS process located in Teesside UK which is expected be operational in 2023 with an initial 20 KTA production line. The facility that will be co-located at Dow‚Äôs plant in Germany would enable a significantly larger capacity for plastic waste and increase the supply of fully circular feedstock to the industry.

Oliver Borek Chief Commercial Officer of Mura Technology said during a video press conference on Sept. 12 that the facility in Germany will have five times the capacity of the Teesside facility. ‚ÄúTeeside is 20000 KTA but that is liquid output which translates to 25000 tons of input. B√∂hlen is 120000 KTA of output‚Äù Borek said.

Dow said there are several advantages of co-locating the advanced recycling plant at its facility. It is expected to significantly reduce scaling costs. In addition it is expected to reduce carbon emissions by minimizing transportation of the product. Plus the gas output from the advanced recycling process can be converted back to plastics so no by-products go to waste.

Dow committed to securing circular feedstocks

"The continuation and growth of Dow and Mura's collaboration is another example of how Dow is working strategically to expand and build momentum around securing circular feedstocks and supporting breakthrough advanced recycling technologies" said Isam Shomaly Dow Business Vice President for Feedstocks and Commodities.

"We continue to increase Dow's capacity to use recycled content as feedstock and continue to invest in the most effective technology available to enable our circular business model for plastics" said Diego Donoso President of Dow Packaging & Specialty Plastics. "The diversification of our feedstock slate and decarbonization of our assets will enable the achievement of Dow's goal of a sustainable low-carbon future and meet strong and growing customer demand for circular polymers. This will be a significant step forward to decrease our dependency on virgin fossil-based feedstocks."

Mura Technology CEO Steve Mahon added "Combating the global plastics crisis requires innovative solutions that can drive a circular economy. Mura's collaboration with Dow has led to the largest commitment across the industry to date showcasing the urgency from industry leaders to adopt scalable solutions such as HydroPRS that will transform the plastics industry worldwide. Dow's continued support for Mura Technology has led to a highly financeable commercial arrangement and the deepening collaboration will allow both companies to achieve their stated ambitions in the advanced recycling space.‚Äù
Name_4: Nasdaq closes higher on Wednesday as stocks stabilize following massive sell-off
Text_4:
The Nasdaq Composite ground higher in choppy trading on Wednesday as investors tried to find their footing after the biggest one-day drop in more than two years.

The Nasdaq rose 0.74% to 11719.68. The S&P 500 added 0.34% to close at 3946.01. The Dow Jones Industrial Average inched up 30.12 points or 0.10% to 31135.09 after being down more than 200 points at session lows.

Moderna was one of the top performers in the Nasdaq jumping more than 6%. Tesla rose 3.6% and Apple tacked on 1%.

The modest gains followed a massive sell-off for stocks on Tuesday. The Dow sank more than 1200 points or nearly 4% while the S&P 500 lost 4.3%. The Nasdaq Composite dropped 5.2%. It was the biggest one-day slide for all three averages since June 2020.

The drop was sparked by August's consumer price index report which showed headline inflation rising 0.1% on a monthly basis despite a drop in gas prices.

The hot inflation report left questions over whether stocks could go back to their June lows or fall even further. It also spurred some fears that the Federal Reserve could hike interest rates even higher than the 75 basis points markets are pricing in.

"Tuesday's selloff is a reminder that a sustained rally is likely to require clear evidence that inflation is on a downward trend. With macroeconomic and policy uncertainty elevated we expect markets to remain volatile in the months ahead" Mark Haefele CIO of UBS Global Wealth Management said in a note to clients.

Market breadth was mixed on Wednesday with declining stocks slightly outnumbering gainers in the S&P 500. Materials stocks slid led to the downside by an 11% drop for Nucor.

Name_5: What you need to know about the new edit and unsend options for iMessage
Text_5:
CNN Business ‚Äî

For anyone prone to typos sending messages to the wrong person or firing off thoughts they may later regret there‚Äôs now some hope. Apple has delivered on two of its most requested features: the ability to edit and unsend iMessages.

This week Apple released its latest operating system iOS 16 which lets users edit an iMessage up to five times within 15 minutes after sending it and unsend any message up to 2 minutes after it‚Äôs sent. Users just need to tap and hold the sent message then select ‚Äúedit‚Äù or ‚Äúundo send.‚Äù

But there are some caveats. For starters it‚Äôs not exactly a stealthy effort: recipients receive an alert that the message was unsent or edited but don‚Äôt see the specific change.

Both users also need to be messaging on Apple devices so it won‚Äôt work for Android exchanges. It works best when the recipient is also using iOS 16 ‚Äî otherwise they‚Äôll receive an awkward timeline of the changes made. SMS messages can‚Äôt be unsent or edited either.

And the sender must hope the recipient didn‚Äôt see a preview of the original message on the lock screen before it was edited or unsent.

Apple (AAPL) is playing catchup to platforms such as Facebook Messenger WhatsApp and Gmail which also offer options to edit or delete messages after they‚Äôre sent. Twitter recently announced it‚Äôs testing the ability for users to edit tweets.

‚ÄúWith Twitter and Apple now also enabling this feature it is clear that this is a trend that many mobile users demand from these platforms‚Äù said Lian Jye Su research director at market research firm ABI Research. ‚ÄúSince the barrier to switching messaging platforms is near zero rich and user-friendly features have become a critical competitive advantage.‚Äù

While they‚Äôre popular requests editing and unsending messages could have an unintended impact on transparency and accountability especially on public platforms by removing or altering the written record. By making it clear the message was edited Apple could help maintain some transparency according to Ramon Llamas an analyst at IDC.

Even with these new options however Lllamas recommends people read over what they send ‚Äúbecause it can come back to haunt you ‚Ä¶ even if you edit it.‚Äù

iOS 16 is now available for any iPhone model dating back to the iPhone 8 which was released in 2017. Other new noteworthy iMessage features include the ability to mark messages as unread so they‚Äôre easier to respond to later and the option to recover recently deleted messages for up to 30 days.

Name_2: 2022 Space Coast HBCA Parade of Homes to Showcase Latest Trends Technology and Temptations
Text_2:
2022 Space Coast HBCA Parade of Homes to Showcase Latest Trends Technology and Temptations

By Space Coast Daily // September 18 2022

This Parade of Homes is larger than its predecessor with 26 entries that feature 24 home models

BREVARD COUNTY FLORIDA ‚Äì Prepare to drool because the Space Coast Home Builders and Contractors Association‚Äôs Parade of Homes is back with all the latest trends technology and temptations that make a house a home you never want to leave. The Parade which opens Sept. 30 and runs through Oct. 10 offers an opportunity to get acquainted with Brevard‚Äôs best builders.

CLICK HERE TO SEE THE BUYERS HOME GUIDE

The Space Coast Home Builders and Contractors Association is home to more than 320 member companies generating an annual economic impact of nearly $500 million and employing an estimated 4000 professionals.

‚ÄúThis year‚Äôs parade highlights some of the Space Coast‚Äôs top builders and offers a wide variety of options across several price points‚Äù said John Thomas CEO of the Space Coast Home Builders and Realtors Association.

With 18 communities throughout Brevard represented in this year‚Äôs parade buyers can choose the location that best suits their needs.

The real estate market may be cooling down but you wouldn‚Äôt know it if you are in Brevard where home building and buying remain sizzling.

‚ÄúThough the residential real estate market is adjusting across the country the Space Coast remains one of the best places to buy a new home anywhere in the United States‚Äù added Thomas.

CLICK HERE TO SEE THE BUYERS HOME GUIDE

In fact this Parade of Homes is larger than its predecessor with 26 entries that feature 24 home models plus a Showcase Community and the Showroom at Refined Interiors in Suntree/Viera.

Homes range in price from $325990 for Holiday Builders‚Äô Sylvester model in Palm Bay to the $3495000 Andros that Christopher Burton Luxury Homes created in Viera‚Äôs exclusive Adelaide community.

Holiday Builders‚Äô Sylvester floorplan ensures the ease of single-story living with four bedrooms two full bathrooms and a generous three-car garage in 1806 square feet.

The split plan provides a welcoming master with plenty of privacy from the other three bedrooms. Additionally the open concept kitchen and living and dining areas are perfect for family gatherings. The kitchen allows plenty of space with 30‚Äù upper cabinets and clean-up is easy with a stainless-steel Energy Star insulated dishwasher.

Each home also comes with a stainless steel electric smooth top range accompanied by a stainless-steel microwave complete with a ductless vent hood light and fan.

CLICK HERE TO SEE THE BUYERS HOME GUIDE

Christopher Burton‚Äôs Andros is enviably situated in stunning Adelaide a 460-acre gated community of custom single-family homes on oversized homesites ringing Viera‚Äôs beautiful Lake Adelaide with elevated lifestyle amenities only moments away. The company operates under the philosophy that a home should make every day feel like a vacation and the Andros certainly accomplishes that goal.

The Andros features four bedrooms four full and two half baths with 4850 square feet and a three-car garage. The expansive game room includes a raised media lounge and a wet bar making it an entertaining showpiece.

Homes start in the lower end of the $30000s at Showcase Community Crystal Bay at the southern end of the county. Builder D.R. Horton offers single-family homes from 1672 to 2601 square feet and that feature three to five bedrooms in one or two floors.

Crystal Bay will include a clubhouse pool and a host of other amenities including bocce and pickleball courts. As ‚ÄúAmerica‚Äôs Smart Home‚Äù D.R. Horton homes are outfitted with an industry-leading suite of smart home products that keep homeowners connected with the people and place they value most.

‚ÄúYou are always connected to your home whether you are sitting on your couch or thousands of miles away‚Äù said D.R. Horton IT director Austin Juarez.

Parade Showroom Refined Interiors offers a one-stop shop for all home design needs with its newly redesigned 6000-square-foot showroom in Suntree/Viera.

The company sells and installs a wide scope of products from flooring cabinetry and stone countertops to backsplashes decorative hardware closet systems LED bathroom mirrors and even kitchen appliances. The end goal was to have one place for clients to go to when remodeling their existing space or building and designing a new one.

The Parade of Homes is possible through the support of sponsors in the industry. The Signature Sponsor this year is US Bank.

‚ÄúAs established members of our community my team feels it is important to help support our valued builder partners in any way we are able‚Äù said Scott Cronenberg retail mortgage branch manager for US Bank.

‚ÄúBy stepping up as the lead sponsor again this year we are able to help showcase our community‚Äôs best most talented builders.‚Äù

Additional sponsors include:

‚ñ† Realtor Sponsor: The Ross Group brokered by Denovo Realty

‚ñ† Awards Sponsor: Florida City Gas

‚ñ† Toast Sponsor: Regions Bank

‚ñ† Dinner Sponsors: Atlantic Tile Capritta Appliance & Air Conditioning Island Tile & Marble Truist

‚ñ† Luxury Car Sponsor: Mercedes of Melbourne

‚ñ† Media Sponsors: Christopher Alan Homes Halco Inc Payne Point Media The Viera Company

‚ñ† Hors D‚Äôoeuvres Sponsors: MG Interiors Gulf Western Roofing Milwaukee Tools Peay‚Äôs Electric

Megan Ross with the Ross Group explains why her company chose to again be the official Realtor Sponsor for the event.

‚ÄúThe Parade of Homes is an excellent way for local builders to showcase their homes and communities to the general public who otherwise might not be aware of their options when looking to build‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúIt also gives Realtors a chance to preview homes and communities to stay knowledgeable within their market. In a world so focused on technology and digital marketing the Parade of Homes is a way for builders to highlight what makes them different by utilizing that in-person special touch.‚Äù

The self-guided tour is a cinch to navigate thanks to QR codes noted in the Parade magazine available digitally. With a smartphone attendees can scan the location of the entries and obtain driving directions in a flash.

The Parade of Homes is not only a feast for the homebuyers‚Äô eyes but it also offers a chance to become acquainted with builders they can trust to make home dreams into reality.

‚ÄúProspective buyers can have peace of mind knowing that the builders in our association follow a code of ethics and are committed to providing the highest quality homes‚Äù said Thomas.

Entries in the Parade of Homes are typically open from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mondays through Saturdays and from noon until 5 p.m. on Sundays during this self-guided tour. However HBCA recommends calling the specific model home directly to ascertain hours of operation.

CLICK HERE for more information.

Name_2: Where Can I Read the 'Boruto' Manga Online?
Text_2:
One of the most popular manga that anime fans are wanting to read is Boruto. After the movie Boruto: Naruto the Movie the anime has taken off. Fans get to follow Boruto Uzumaki a teenager who witnesses the destruction of his village. He is incredibly angry and upset with his father for putting the good of the village ahead of his family.

Recommended Videos

Boruto decides to become a member of a ninja team. He is then given countless different tests and exams in order to show his ability and prove that he is worthy to stay a member of the team. During these tests Naruto is kidnapped so Baruto along with other members of the team are tasked with going after the hero.

During the retrieval Baruto witnesses Sasuke battle and fight and decides that he wants to become just like Sasuke. Baruto has the honor of serving as a bodyguard for Tento who is the Fire Daimyo‚Äôs son. Later on after Isshiki is destroyed by Boruto Naruto Sasuke and Kawaki Code decides he wants to avenge the death.

Code is one of the most powerful villains and easily is able to find Boro and get past his bodyguards. Code employs a female cyborg who agrees to help kill Naruto on the agreement that Kawaki is safe. She is unable to find love due to her powers and Kawaki is one of the few people in the entire anime with whom she is able to have a romance.

Where can fans read the Boruto manga online?

Image via Viz Media

Luckily for anime fans finding the Boruto manga online is very easy. All that fans have to do is go to the Viz Media site and they can read all of the mangas. There are so many different stories and arcs to follow and Viz has all of the stories that fans could ever want right there.

Viz Media does not just have Boruto manga to read but also countless other manga that anime fans love and adore. Viz Media also offers suggestions for different manga to read based on what you are already reading. Being able to pick up and read different stories that are similar is incredibly nice to do.

Name_2: New waterfront space for Long Eaton would 'brighten up' popular park area
Text_2:
Our free email updates are the best way to get headlines direct to your inbox

Our free email updates are the best way to get headlines direct to your inbox

Plans to regenerate a popular waterfront area and 'well used' park is exactly what an East Midlands town needs residents say. The plans for Long Eaton's West Park and along the Erewash Canal form part of an award of ¬£24.8m from the Government for the town's Investment Plan

The project is one of seven projects within the town's transformation with the plans are currently under consideration. The waterfront development would include a seating area to enjoy the park as well as facilities for refreshments and to launch small watercraft.

The events space will allow for a wider variety of events along with more car parking spaces. Park goers in the town say the plans for the ‚Äòwell used‚Äô West Park are needed and will ‚Äòbrighten‚Äô the space up.

Read More: Nottinghamshire grandmother ashamed of 'disgusting' damp in her council house

Joseph Blake who usually walks his dog in the park told Nottinghamshire Live that residents would appreciate an additional space to the park. The 48 year old said: ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs needed. This park is well used and I think many would appreciate something new. I think with the water it will be good especially during the summer. It‚Äôs something the town needs we have lost a lot.‚Äù

The Erewash Borough Council has said the plans for the project on the park should benefit residents by providing an abundance of new employment opportunities.

Sheila Statham 84 who has lived in Long Eaton her whole life said that it would brighten the park up. She added: ‚ÄúI think anything to make it feel more comfortable for people. Myself I quite like the look of it it‚Äôs rough and ready. We are very lucky to have this.

‚ÄúI think so to brighten it up. People will come if they can shelter and watch the wildlife. There‚Äôs a lot of wildlife on here swans and squirrels. People like to come and look at the birds people want somewhere to sit and watch.

(Image: Nottingham Post)

The 84-year-old added: It‚Äôs somewhere nice. And it‚Äôs being used more now than it‚Äôs ever been used. We are really lucky to have this facility.‚Äù

The town's funding also involves the redevelopment of the former Galaxy cinema on Derby Road. The proposals for the redevelopment includes commercial units fronting Derby Road 16 flats and four new town houses.

The town houses are proposed to front on Oxford Street behind the cinema. Vehicle access will also be from Oxford Street which will lead to a courtyard and 27 parking spaces.

Another resident who visits the park Natalie Bowley told Nottinghamshire Live that it‚Äôs a positive bringing more into the town. The 34-year-old said: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really good if it brings business and people to the area. There‚Äôs not much in Long Eaton. It needs something that brings in more people.‚Äù

Kerrie Walters 32 who was walking her two dogs said that it‚Äôs welcomed due to the lack of things going off in Long Eaton. She said: ‚ÄúI think it will be good. But what I think would be nice is the splash thing for the kids I think it would be good to have one for dogs. They‚Äôd love it.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs not a lot going off in Long Eaton really so anything to make the days less boring.‚Äù

Richard Ledger chairman of the Long Eaton Town Board says: "These projects may still be in the early stages but when they come to fruition they will provide improved leisure and recreation facilities for residents.

"The leisure hub would also attract more visitors to the park and the town as a whole."

The council says the plans for the park which is on the edge of the town centre off Wilsthorpe Road will be delivered in two parts. The first would involve the development of "a stunning waterfront alongside the Erewash Canal including an area for seating to enjoy the park as well as facilities for refreshments and to launch small watercraft."

The second part of the project includes an improved events space which will allow for a wider variety of events with more car parking space to help encourage more people to visit the park more often. "This is just one part of the exciting proposals for the Long Eaton Town Deal" Mr Ledger adds "and we look forward to making improvements to the town that can be enjoyed by everyone.‚Äù

Name_3: Plans for huge new Lidl and Wickes store on 'prominent' site in Derbyshire town
Text_3:
Amended plans have been submitted to build a Lidl supermarket and Wickes DIY store after a long-running back and forth between developers and a Derbyshire council to transform a derelict site. The former industrial site off Nottingham Road Long Eaton has been left derelict since 2014 amid negotiations.

Plans were originally put forward by Lidl and Clowes Developments in 2018 but refused by Erewash Borough Council on the grounds that other preferable sites had not yet been considered and it could have an adverse impact on the vitality of the town centre. There were also concerns Nottinghamshire Live reports that the new shops could harm the appearance of that stretch of road which was once home to Stadium Industrial Park and Long Eaton Trade Centre.

Shortly after the plans were rejected Lidl said 298 local residents had written to them saying they wanted the development to go ahead. The rejection was overturned on appeal in 2020 with the planning inspector saying the two stores would only divert a small proportion of trade from Long Eaton town centre and that the town‚Äôs retail was ‚Äúrobust enough‚Äù to withstand the impact.

READ MORE: Glass in gardens stuck doors and 'broken promises' at new Derby housing estate

Since then the proposals for the 1.68 hectare site have been revised and will go before the Erewash planning committee on October 12. The proposals include a change in the shape of the Wickes building from square to rectangle with the addition of a mezzanine floor for displaying kitchens and bathrooms with customer seating interview areas for the design team and toilets.

The new design has prompted amendments to the layout of the development service yard and car park. There would be 165 parking spaces - 55 fewer than originally approved - and additional landscaping.

The plans state: "In the context of the buildings already approved the increase in the width of the Wickes store would not materially alter the impact on visual or residential amenity arising from the development. The proposed changes ensure the plans are more responsive to the requirements of the retailers which are driven by customer demand. The development will create a viable attractive and welcoming commercial environment which is well designed and laid out within the context and constraints of the site."

The new supermarket would create 40 new full and part-time jobs and approximately 26 new full and part-time jobs at Wickes. Clowes has been working closely with the council's senior planning officer in a bid to make the amended proposals successful.

Marc Freeman the development director at Clowes responsible for delivering the scheme said: "We have also received support from local residents who are excited to benefit from the proposed retail offering."

Workers are currently on site constructing access from Nottingham Road under the original consent which will help to expedite the delivery of the proposed scheme if approved. If given the green light the stores should be ready to open in 2024.

"It would regenerate a prominent site in Long Eaton that has been redundant for a number of years which will benefit the local community" added Mr Freeman.

Name_5: 'Skeg Vegas' amusement arcade opens in Long Eaton with 2p machines and sand pits
Text_5:
Something went wrong please try again later.

Invalid email Something went wrong please try again later.
