Something went wrong please try again later.

Our free email updates are the best way to get headlines direct to your inbox

It's almost 90 miles away from the coast but a new amusements arcade is aiming to bring a slice of the seaside to a town just over the border from Notts. Jones Retro Amusements opened in Long Eaton's High Street on September 3.

The building was previously a cafe named Fill Ya Face however owners Michelle Jones and husband Terry Jones decided they wanted to bring something different to the High Street. Having owned arcades in the past the married couple changed their cafe to a family amusement.

Mrs Jones said it felt like an end of an era closing the cafe. The 39 year old said: ‚ÄúEverybody that we‚Äôve spoken to has been positive it‚Äôs something different.

Read More: Shoppers say new restaurants and cinema are putting Notts town 'on the map'

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen all ages come in the weekend is a lot busier with the kids they especially like the glitter and face painting we‚Äôve done a lot of them.

Mrs Jones added: ‚ÄúThe high street just needs an injection a bit of life. There‚Äôs something for all ages sand pits outside a variety of machines cheap tea and coffee. When there‚Äôs quite a few people in it‚Äôs a nice feel a good atmosphere.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just nice to have brought something a bit different a bit of fun. If people ever want to come for a cup of tea and let the kids play.

"It‚Äôs been weird we‚Äôve had an arcade before so to be back it‚Äôs been very strange. I think the day we swapped it all over felt like the end of an era. We have been open for three years.‚Äù

(Image: Nottingham Post)

The ‚ÄòSkeg Vegas‚Äô amusements is open from 8.30am until 6pm every day of the week. Mrs Jones also spoke of the struggles of running the cafe in the aftermath of Covid and the current cost of living crisis. She said: ‚ÄúYou come in and have a bit of fun without spending. The cost of living is what it is you‚Äôve got to do the best you can. For small businesses they feel it more than the rest with such tight profit margins.

‚ÄúWe were watching the shopping going up the electricity then started looking at staffing costing reduced opening hours. After covid and the living costs it just wasn‚Äôt feasible for us to stay open. It‚Äôs crazy everybody that you speak to is all in the boat.‚Äù

(Image: Nottingham Post)

The former cafe has everything from sand pits to 2p machines and teddy bear grabbers face painting and hot drinks. The owners want to give locals something different and something fun.

Mr Jones 43 added: ‚ÄúI had a couple of customers come in and said it‚Äôs absolutely unbelievable for Long Eaton it‚Äôs something fun.

He adds that they‚Äôre almost there with completing the ‚ÄòSkeg Vegas‚Äô look. Mr Jones said: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre halfway there at the minute not fully there. People have said they love it. We‚Äôve got a few more bits planned‚Äù.

Name: eBay
Name_1: As I Listed My Atari on eBay I Was Shocked at the Game Prices
Text_1:
I recently listed my Atari 2600 gaming console for sale and within minutes I had a bid on the item.

That made me wonder why someone bid on the item so quickly so I started to do a little research.

I am selling the console along with 37 games two joystick controllers the TV/Game A/B switch and the cable to bridge the gap between the console and the television.

Staff Photo Staff Photo loading...

The first person to bid has an eBay username of atarisandmore so it sounds like that user is someone who is expert at all things Atari.

As I started to browse through atarisandmore's offerings I realized that there were NO Atari game cartridges for sale on the profile for less than around $9.

Staff Photo Staff Photo loading...

That means that if atarisandmore wins the bid (it opened at $44.10) after shipping he (or she) will have spent around $60 for the console the two controllers and 37 games.

On atarisandmore's profile on eBay he lists an Atari 2600 (4-switch) with 20 games as a package for $199.

Staff Photo Staff Photo loading...

And if he is able to sell the remaining 17 cartridges he buys from me (if he wins the auction) he'll sell each of those for at least $8.99. All-in-all he stands to make almost $200 by reselling what he just bought from me.

So what does that tell you?

It tells you this: I am not good at eBay-ing.

Staff Photo Staff Photo loading...

I only looked up a few consoles that were up for sale and they were selling for between $35 and $55 dollars so I thought that I would list mine for around $45. A happy medium right?

Staff Photo Staff Photo loading...

What I didn't do was price each of the games individually before including them with the console. Had I done that I would have realized that they were each worth at least $5.

So I shorted myself by at least $200 if this thing sells with the current bid.

And this ladies and gentlemen is why I don't own a business.

Oh there is also one "mystery" game cartridge included in my listing. There is no label on the game cartridge so I have no idea what game it is. With my luck it's a super rare game that he'll be able to sell for a nice profit!

Staff Photo Staff Photo loading...

It is one of the Parker Brothers games which include titles such as Star Wars Frogger Q*Bert Popeye Super Cobra and even McDonald's. Some of these titles are going for as much as $20!

Well here's to hoping that I'll get some more bids on my Atari 2600 console and the games. They have provided me with lots of great fun over the years but it's time to declutter!

If you have an old Atari laying around with some game cartridges it might be worth it to check the values.

For instance the Atari 2600 Beam Rider game is selling online right now for around $65. There's an Asteroids cartridge (Silver Label) for sale for around $60. Night Driver: $50. Tax Avoiders: $40. Tanks But No Tanks Donkey Kong Junior Jawbreaker Rubik's Cube Pitfall - all above $30.

But if you have a factory-sealed Legend of Zelda game it could bring you a LOT of money! There's one listed on eBay right now for $100000. ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS? How crazy is that??

via eBay via eBay loading...

How about this Atari 2600 factory-sealed E.T. (Extra Terrestrial) game? Would you believe that it's for sale for almost $20000?

via eBay via eBay loading...

Check the closets the attic the basement and your storage unit - if you own an Atari 2600 Video Computer System you might be in for a small windfall.

Name_2: eBay Bans Sales of Queen Elizabeth's Lying in State Wristbands
Text_2:
eBay is removing listings for wristbands for the queue to view Queen Elizabeth II's coffin from its website.

In a statement to Insider a spokesperson for eBay said the items go against the site's policies.

Thousands of mourners have donned the colored bracelets as they wait in line.

Access your favorite topics in a personalized feed while you're on the go. download the app Email address Sign up By clicking ‚ÄúSign Up‚Äù you accept our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy . You can opt-out at any time.

Advertisement

eBay has removed dozens of listings for wristbands from the queue to see Queen Elizabeth II's coffin at Westminster Hall The Guardian reports.

According to the outlet some wristbands drew bids of up to ¬£70000 which equates to about $80755. The Telegraph reports that the free bracelets were numbered to allow mourners to leave the queue for food or to use the bathroom and return to their place. The bands are also color-coded by day meaning they would be ineffectual for someone trying to cut the line.

Name_3: eBay bans sale of Queen lying-in-state wristbands
Name_4: eBay removes wristbands given to those queuing to see Queen's coffin
Text_4:
eBay said the items were against its policies (Alamy/PA)

The online site eBay is removing listings for the wristbands given to people queueing to see the Queen lying in state.

Some people have sought to cash in by selling the bands which have reportedly attracted bids of several thousand pounds before being removed.

An eBay spokesperson said: ‚ÄúThese items are against our policies and we are removing them from our site.‚Äù

The guard is changed as members of the public file past the coffin of the Queen lying in state in Westminster Hall (Yui Mok/PA) (PA Wire)

The eBay events tickets policy says tickets for things such as concerts festivals sports or theatre cannot be listed on the site.

A few orange wristbands remained on the site under the header ‚Äúnew listing‚Äù on Sunday morning.

They were priced with starting bids from ¬£20 to ¬£150.
Name_5: How clever mechanics keep 50-year-old BART trains running: Windows 98 eBay and scraps
Text_5:
When BART first carried passengers the country was sending astronauts to the moon. The Apollo-era trains were symbols of a generation barreling toward a space-age future complete with carpeted floors and a seat promised to every passenger.

That was 1972 when BART was state of the art. But half a century later as the agency celebrates its 50th anniversary this month many of those same silver-and-blue trains are still chugging through the Bay Area. And keeping them running ‚Äî even in the country‚Äôs technology capital ‚Äî requires a special breed of ingenuity.

BART mechanics rely on Frankensteined laptops operating with Windows 98 train yard scraps and vintage microchips to keep Bay Area commuters on the rails.

‚ÄúWe have literally started with a picture and scoured different manufacturers and eBay looking for an oddball part‚Äù said John Allen a mechanic who specializes in breathing new life into broken down BART trains. When Car 372 caught fire in Orinda in 2013 his team created an entirely new system and built their own tools to replace the floor. ‚ÄúSometimes we don‚Äôt even know what the name of the part is.‚Äù

To understand why BART upkeep is so complicated take a look back to the founders. They shunned heavy steel trains and old-school signaling technology and instead hired an aerospace company to build a train fleet that would serve as a new model for public transit. The result? All-electric trains with sleek aluminum bodies and wide windows underpinned by nearly autonomous operations. The price tag for BART‚Äôs original 450 cars: $160 million.

‚ÄúBART was envisioned as a renaissance system‚Äù said Mike Healy the agency‚Äôs longtime spokesperson and BART historian. In 1972 it ‚Äúwas sort of the new kid on the block.‚Äù

But much of the hardware quickly went out of date. Even as Silicon Valley sprouted next door the trains remained tethered to a safe but arcane automated train control system that depended on DOS ‚Äî a computer operating system now relegated to the dustbin of history ‚Äî for vital operations. BART inspired train networks in Washington D.C. and Atlanta yet its specific mechanics were never widely replicated.

Today the transit system is an outlier with everything from wheels to windows crying out for custom-built attention.

‚ÄúThe biggest stumbling block is coming up with parts that they don‚Äôt make anymore‚Äù said Mark Wing a mechanic who oversees maintenance on the entire train spanning electrical propulsion equipment to busted seats.

Which parts are not made any more? ‚ÄúPretty much everything‚Äù he said.

When a BART car runs into trouble Shawn Stange steps back in time. He pops open a circa-2000 IBM Thinkpad running Windows 98 and opens a portal into the train‚Äôs brain ‚Äî the Automated Train Control system ‚Äî through the DOS computer language.

Much as if he were conducting a vehicle diagnostic test Stange uses the software as a mechanic‚Äôs roadmap. ‚ÄúThis stuff was written so long ago. So you have to take Windows 10 and open up a virtual Windows 98 box and then run the (DOS) program to download the log files‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs primitive.‚Äù

Stacks of vintage laptop carcasses are common at BART warehouses. The train software is so old it won‚Äôt work on modern computers.

‚ÄúI was in an engineering office and I bet he had 40 of them sitting on the floor stacked up‚Äù said Allen. ‚ÄúRob this part and rob that part to keep one laptop going. You see that here all the time.‚Äù

Perhaps the most illustrative symbol of BART‚Äôs go-it-alone approach is its iconic 1970s lead cars which have a dedicated fan base among transit design aficionados. The sloped nose was built for a futuristic effect but had little practical purpose and even prevented the trains from switching interchangeably with flat-faced vehicles. Irrespective of functionality the shape became BART‚Äôs ‚Äúidentity‚Äù said Healy.

Today 56 of the original lead cars known as A cars are still in operation BART spokesperson Jim Allison said. Their mechanical innards were replaced during a mid-life rebuilding of the legacy fleet starting in the late 1990s but the same pointed nose greets tens of thousands of passengers every day. Another 341 of the trailing ‚ÄúB Cars‚Äù from the 1970s are still in use along with 60 ‚ÄúC cars‚Äù which were built in the 1980s.

In June the family of legacy lead cars became just a little smaller. Car 1204 derailed and it now lives at the Concord maintenance yard scorching under the most recent heat wave. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll go to Schnitzer Steel in Oakland and get crushed‚Äù said Allison.

But before Car 1204 meets the trash compactor mechanics picked through the train‚Äôs bones in recent weeks. They pulled headlight sockets and popped out its hard-to-replicate conductor windows to preserve parts.

‚ÄúThe window is kind of bowed out like a bubble‚Äù said Scott Fitzgerald a manager at the Concord yard adding that they have just one spare left. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how many attempts the glassmaker has tried to get that arc correctly.‚Äù

One of the first people to see BART‚Äôs space-age trains running through the Bay Area was Mekela Edwards. On Sept. 11 1972 she was a toddler slung over her mother Theresa‚Äôs shoulder when the pair became the system‚Äôs first paying customers. ‚ÄúSometimes I introduce myself as BART‚Äôs first baby‚Äù said Edwards who is now a teacher in Palo Alto.

For her the trains always had an air of discovery on trips from Oakland to San Francisco. But Edward‚Äôs connection to BART also parallels many passengers‚Äô love-hate relationship with the system as the dated trains struggle with cleanliness delays and notoriously failing air conditioners.

And as she grew older her frustration with BART sometimes bubbled over into angry social media posts when the crowded old cars morphed into saunas. ‚ÄúI just could not believe it was so hot on the train‚Äù she said recounting a trip in 2016. ‚ÄúAnd so I was tweeting ‚Äòdo something about this.'‚Äù

Related Articles Transportation | Tech company settles allegations it submitted false claims about equipment used by Bay Area transit agencies

Tech company settles allegations it submitted false claims about equipment used by Bay Area transit agencies Transportation | Borenstein: VTA will keep blocking independent review of BART extension through San Jose

Borenstein: VTA will keep blocking independent review of BART extension through San Jose Transportation | BART equipment problem shuts down service between Richmond and Oakland

BART equipment problem shuts down service between Richmond and Oakland Transportation | San Jose BART extension to receive $500 million in upcoming federal budget

San Jose BART extension to receive $500 million in upcoming federal budget Transportation | BART will get a decade of use out of cars meant for San Jose extension on VTA‚Äôs dime BART is doing something. Its old trains are being slowly phased out. Most will be sent to the junkyards in the next two years and a handful will be repurposed for among other things a local beer garden video-game arcade and firefighter training. The Western Railway Museum in Solano County is also fundraising to save historic BART cars for a new exhibit.

Taking their place will be the $2.6 billion ‚ÄúFleet of the Future‚Äù which already makes up nearly a third of the trains. The cars have cooler cabins LCD map screens and yellow and blue seats. Along with a revamped train control system the new fleet is meant to finally push BART into the 21st century even as its initial rollout is hampered by software glitches.

Finding replacement parts won‚Äôt be a problem and DOS is no longer necessary for Allen and his crew but it will still be bittersweet to say goodbye to trains that they have lovingly kept alive.

‚ÄúThere is a part of me that definitely has a little tear in my eye‚Äù said Allen who has dedicated the past 16 years to BART repairs. ‚ÄúI think we could probably rebuild the fleet again and keep it going . . . but you know out with the old and in with the new.‚Äù

Fifty years of BART

2302680: Average mileage for BART‚Äôs 1970s train cars

89: Number of train cars that operated in 1972 and are still in use today

‚ÄúIt will never work‚Äù ‚Äî Margaret Thatcher in 1969 after touring BART

$2.6 billion: Cost of BART‚Äôs 775 new ‚ÄúFleet of the Future‚Äù trains

70 mph: BART‚Äôs maximum speed

Name: Edwards Lifesciences
Name_1: Pascal TEER Device as Good as MitraClip in Head-to-Head CLASP IID
Text_1:
The device met its primary noninferiority endpoint for safety and efficacy against MitraClip in degenerative MR patients.

BOSTON MA‚Äî(UPDATED) Patients with severe symptomatic degenerative mitral regurgitation (MR) ineligible for surgery fare just as well when treated with the Pascal device (Edwards Lifesciences) as those treated with MitraClip (Abbott) according to the CLASP IID study.

The results which were presented as a late-breaking clinical trial at TCT 2022 and published simultaneously in JACC: Cardiovascular Interventions come just 2 days after the US Food and Drug Administration approved the Pascal transcatheter edge-to-edge repair (TEER) system for the treatment of degenerative MR making it just the second device available in the US.

‚ÄúThe CLASP IID trial is the first randomized controlled trial to directly compare the two TEER therapies and further establishes the safety and effectiveness of mitral valve TEER for degenerative mitral regurgitation patients with prohibitive surgical risk‚Äù said study investigator Konstantinos Koulogiannis MD (Atlantic Health System Morristown Medical Center NJ) during a press conference. ‚ÄúIt met its primary safety and effectiveness endpoints with the Pascal system demonstrating low composite major adverse events and a significant sustained MR reduction.‚Äù

Lead investigator D. Scott Lim MD (University of Virginia Health System Hospital Charlottesville VA) said the introduction of a second device is important as it provides physicians and patients with options.

‚ÄúThe two devices have different design features that I think may be beneficial in different anatomies‚Äù said Lim.

For example Pascal‚Äôs hollow nitinol-frame construction allows it to close passively and flex during systole and diastole. The device also elongates allowing it to be maneuvered into anatomies with denser mitral chords said Lim. The clasps for grasping the mitral leaflets can be operated in tandem or independently allowing for staged leaflet capture and adjustment and a central spacer helps to bridge the coaptation gap so the leaflets aren‚Äôt pulled as tightly together.

Federico Asch MD (MedStar Health/Georgetown University Washington DC) who wasn‚Äôt involved in CLASP IID congratulated the researchers saying the field has now entered a new era. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been building a lot of data with MitraClip as a device but as a composite it‚Äôs important to now show that TEER works. There are going to be patients who are better candidates for one [device] or another. I don‚Äôt think we have that answer right now‚Äù he said.

The two devices have different design features that I think may be beneficial in different anatomies. D. Scott Lim

Speaking with TCTMD Janarthanan Sathananthan MBChB (University of British Columbia/Vancouver General Hospital/St. Paul‚Äôs Hospital Vancouver Canada) who wasn‚Äôt involved in the study echoed Asch‚Äôs comments.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs beneficial to have another device to offer TEER as an option‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen the struggles that we‚Äôve had with screening for transcatheter mitral valve replacement. We have high exclusion rates so having another device that offers a therapeutic option for edge-to-edge repair is beneficial. CLASP IID also reinforces the benefits of edge-to-edge repair‚Äù

Interim Analysis of 180 Patients

The CLASP IID study included 180 patients enrolled at 43 sites in the United States Canada and Europe between 2018 and 2021. Up to 300 patients are planned for enrollment. However interim analyses were planned for 180 210 and 240 patients provided the sample size was deemed sufficient for analyzing the primary endpoint. At 180 patients the interim analysis proceeded because the predictive probability for study success exceeded 96.5% say investigators.

The current analysis included 117 patients treated with Pascal and 63 treated with MitraClip with frailty the most common reason that patients in both treatment groups were ineligible for surgery. Both were well matched but those who received the Pascal device were more likely to have undergone prior aortic valve surgery or TAVI. Two-thirds of patients received the Pascal implant;24.1% received the newer Pascal Ace device which is narrower has a shorter profile and longer clasps; and 8.6% received a combination. In the MitraClip arm 39.3% were treated with an NT/NTR/XTR device while 60.7% received the newer-generation G4 device which has independent clasps for gripping the mitral leaflets.

With respect to major adverse events‚Äîa composite safety endpoint that included cardiovascular death stroke MI need for renal replacement therapy severe bleeding and nonelective mitral valve reintervention‚Äîthe Pascal system met the margin for noninferiority when compared with MitraClip (3.4% with Pascal vs 4.8% with MitraClip). At 30 days the 1.3% difference in major adverse events had a one-sided upper confidence boundary of 5.1% which fell within the prespecified 15% noninferiority margin.

With Pascal there was one cardiovascular death three severe bleeds and one mitral-valve reintervention. In the MitraClip group there was one cardiovascular death and two severe bleeds.

In terms of effectiveness the proportion of patients with MR ‚â§ 2+ at 6 months 96.5% with Pascal and 96.8% with MitraClip. The absolute difference of 0.3% had a one-sided lower confidence boundary of 6.2% which fell within the prespecified noninferiority margin of 18%. Regardless of device all patients achieved MR ‚â§ 2+ at discharge while 87.2% and 88.5% of the Pascal- and MitraClip-treated patients had MR ‚â§ 1+ at discharge. At 6 months 83.7% of the Pascal-treated patients and 71.2% of the MitraClip-treated patients had sustained MR ‚â§ 1+ suggesting there was ‚Äúsome loss of efficacy over the same course of follow-up‚Äù with MitraClip according to investigators. Mean valve gradients were stable over time in both groups.

There are going to be patients who are better candidates for one [device] or another. I don‚Äôt think we have that answer right now. Federico Asch

Commenting on this signal Lim told TCTMD: ‚ÄúObviously this is only 6 months only 180 patients . . . We have to see if this bears out over the entire cohort over much longer follow-up. If it does then I think it is something operators will consider. It is mirrored in at least two other publications out of Europe that when they compared [Pascal] to MitraClip [they] seemed to find a decrease in efficacy with the MitraClip patients. It may bear out but right now it‚Äôs a little early to say.‚Äù

Sathananthan pointed out that CLASP IID does have limitations most notably the low patient numbers. However a second device one that appears to have less residual MR than that seen with MitraClip is a valuable addition. To TCTMD Sathananthan said one of the conundrums faced by operators who‚Äôve performed edge-to-edge repair is that the severity of MR can be underestimated immediately after the procedure. Then at follow-up it‚Äôs not uncommon for MR to be a little bit higher than expected.

‚ÄúSo that sustained benefit [with Pascal] is promising‚Äù he said calling it a signal that is worth watching in the larger cohort and over long-term follow-up. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nice to try to get surgical-like repair results at the end. All of this is positive for the field.‚Äù

Anita Asgar MD MSc (Montreal Heart Institute Canada) one of the panelists during the late-breaking science presentation called CLASP IID an important study for TEER as it highlights the safety of the procedure but also cautioned against making much of the direct comparison given the small number of patients especially since just 37 patients in the MitraClip arm received the new-generation G4 device.

Another panelist David Cohen MD (St. Francis Hospital Roslyn NY) pointed out there is observational data suggesting that achieving MR ‚â§ 1+ is better for patients with degenerative MR. If a difference between MitraClip and Pascal emerges with respect to these sustained MR reductions he said it could be a factor when choosing devices.

Quality of Life and Functional Outcomes

Patients in both treatment arms had significant improvements in functional capacity and quality of life when compared with baseline but there was no difference between devices. Procedure times were longer with the Pascal device (88 vs 79 minutes) but declined over time suggesting there is a small learning curve with the device. Most of the participating sites did not have prior experience with the Pascal device prior to CLASP IID the researchers point out.

Lim said that one advantage of MitraClip is the extent of operator experience noting that operators may lean towards it because they are comfortable implanting it. In terms of anatomy more complicated or thicker mitral leaflets requiring mechanical closure might also be suitable for MitraClip he said.

The full trial has completed enrollment and patients are currently being followed. They hope to present data from the full 300-patient cohort early next year said Lim.

The Pascal system has CE Mark approval in Europe for both MR and tricuspid regurgitation.

There are ongoing studies comparing TEER with MitraClip versus surgical mitral valve repair in patients with degenerative MR. One of those studies PRIMARY is a superiority trial funded by the National Institutes of Health with a planned enrollment of 450 patients at all levels of surgical risk. The other study is REPAIR MR a noninferiority study testing MitraClip versus valve repair surgery in degenerative MR patients at intermediate risk. Results from both trials aren‚Äôt expected for several years.

The CLASP IIF study is also ongoing. In that study investigators are comparing Pascal to MitraClip in patients with functional MR and prohibitive surgical risk.

Name_3: Sizing Mismatch a Problem for Balloon-Expandable Valves in Small Annuli TAVI
Text_3:
Worryingly mismatch at 1 year also predicted 3-year all-cause death spurring calls for RCTs in this setting.

BOSTON MA‚ÄîCompared with balloon-expandable bioprosthetic aortic valves self-expanding devices show superior hemodynamic performance at 1 year in patients with small annuli undergoing TAVI according to new registry data. Moreover use of a balloon-expandable valve was associated with moderate or severe patient-prosthesis mismatch (PPM) at 1 year which also was an independent predictor of all-cause mortality at 3 years.

The observational results should be interpreted with caution said Walid Ben-Ali MD PhD (Montreal Heart Institute Canada) who presented the data today at TCT 2022 but ‚Äúbasically when you have severe PPM at 1 year you have a twofold relative hazard for all-cause mortality at 3 years.‚Äù

The findings aren‚Äôt yet enough to suggest that all patients with small annuli should be treated with self-expanding valves though several experts said.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs very difficult when you have these propensity-matched analyses to really make definitive decisions on that basis‚Äù said Alexandra Lansky MD (Yale University School of Medicine New Haven CT) during a discussion in the late-breaking clinical trial session. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important. I do think it needs to be validated. You need long-term follow-up. You need matched populations et cetera. So I think validating this in a prospective trial is important.‚Äù

Likewise Susheel Kodali MD (NewYork-Presbyterian/Columbia University Irving Medical Center NY) cautioned the audience that it‚Äôs easy to be seduced by large observational data sets and the signals they can suggest ‚Äúespecially when you are dealing with devices that are so different.‚Äù He emphasized that valve types are chosen for a variety of reasons including lifetime management need for pacemaker and coronary access.

‚ÄúWe all agree we want the largest valve area and we struggle with how to assess it what the valve area truly is and we make decisions based on a lot of factors‚Äù Kodali continued. ‚ÄúThis is really enticing but we have to wait for the data to answer the question that was asked: will it impact . . . device choice?‚Äù

The panelists agreed that the ongoing SMART trial will hopefully give more definitive answers in this space.

FRANCE-TAVI Results

For the study Ben-Ali and colleagues included data on 1195 patients from the FRANCE-TAVI registry with small aortic annuli‚Äîdefined as a diameter ‚â§ 23 mm or an indexed diameter ‚â§ 12 mm/m2 measured on CT‚Äîwho underwent TAVI with either a supra-annular self-expanding valve (Evolut R/Pro; Medtronic) or a balloon-expandable device (Sapien 3; Edwards Lifesciences).

The researchers conducted propensity matching through two methods. The first (n = 928) used 10 anatomical and clinical variables to create a propensity score and patients were matched in a 1:3 fashion depending on whether they were treated with a self-expanding or balloon-expandable device. The second (n = 1195) used the propensity score to generate an inverse probability treatment weighting (IPTW) as a sensitivity analysis.

After matching both cohorts were comparable in terms of demographics and basic echocardiographic and CT data as well as procedural and postprocedural results. However the hemodynamic performance was significantly better with the supra-annular self-expanding valves compared with balloon-expandable devices in terms of lower mean gradient and larger index effective orifice area at discharge 30 days and 1 year (P < 0.001 for all).

The rates of moderate or severe PPM at 1 year were significantly higher in the balloon expandable versus self-expanding valve groups before and after matching (P < 0.001 for all). Female sex (HR 1.59; 95% CI 1.14-2.17) small annuli (HR 2.38 per 1-mm decrease; 95% CI 1.27-4.55) postprocedural mean gradient (HR 1.04 per 1-mm Hg increase; 95% CI 1.01-1.06) and valve type (HR 2.94; 95% CI 1.79-4.76) were all found to be independent predictors of moderate to severe PPM at 1 year in both matching strategies.

‚ÄúPatients treated with balloon expandable valves have threefold relative hazard to develop a moderate to severe PPM at 1 year‚Äù Ben-Ali said.

Additionally severe PPM at 1 year (HR 2.01; 95% CI 1.02-3.95) length of index hospitalization (HR 1.05 per 1-day increase; 95% CI 1.01-1.09) major bleeding (HR 2.86; 95% CI 1.07-7.66) and atrial fibrillation (HR 3.46; 95% CI 2.08-5.74) were all found to be independent predictors of 3-year mortality in the first matching strategy. Using the IPTW strategy valve type (HR 1.93; 95% CI 1.2-3.11) and annulus size (HR 1.23 per 1-mm decrease; 95% CI 1.06-1.41) also were predictors of 3-year all-cause mortality.

‚ÄòPower of Large Registries‚Äô

During the discussion Bernard Prendergast MD (St Thomas' Hospital London England) said that the assessment of PPM is well known to be complicated ‚Äúand achieving those measurements in the context of a national registry without a core lab is a very difficult call. That said‚Äù he continued ‚ÄúI think this study and [the TEER SHOCK registry presented in the same session] have shown the power of large registries to yield data which guide the field. And while patient-prosthesis mismatch may not be so important in very elderly patients many of whom are in this registry we know from the surgical data that PPM is important in younger patients.‚Äù

Prendergast added that ‚Äúthese data are a call to our colleagues in industry and the engineers who design new valves to think about the needs of patients with small annuli as we move into the fourth and fifth generations of TAVR devices.‚Äù

These data are a call to our colleagues in industry and the engineers who design new valves to think about the needs of patients with small annuli as we move into the fourth and fifth generations of TAVR devices. Bernard Prendergast

In a press conference Michael Young MD (Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center Lebanon NH) said he is ‚Äúcautiously reassured about the findings from this because in our practice I do think that we're thinking about this very carefully.‚Äù He added that some of the surgeons at his institutions are ‚Äúaggressive about doing root enlargements in the hopes for these small annuli getting a larger surgical prosthetic valve.‚Äù

In his practice Young added ‚Äúwe've swayed toward a supra-annular design‚Äù for patients with small annuli. Many end up with a ‚Äúgradient of 17-20 mm Hg when they start with a gradient of 40 mm Hg. They feel better they generally feel well but you just don't know number one durability and then number two what their clinical outcomes are going to be.‚Äù

Another issue that comes into play when choosing a bioprosthesis relates to lifetime management of the patient Young said. ‚ÄúThat has actually come into discourse in terms of choosing SAVR vs TAVR at this point. Usually when the annulus is small we‚Äôre also looking at the sinuses and sometimes the sinuses can be very small. So you worry about sinus sequestration and boxing the patient in so to speak in the next 5-10 years who knows what their coronary options will be.‚Äù

Also during the press conference Robert Cubeddu MD (NCH Heart Institute Naples FL) said that while the data support ‚Äúwhat we already kind of know and think we have to remind ourselves this is a retrospective view with a nonadjudicated core lab definitions of PPM et cetera which are incredibly important.‚Äù

Awaiting SMART Results

The data place added pressure on the SMART trial data said David J. Cohen MD (St. Francis Hospital Roslyn NY) during the TCT session. ‚ÄúAnd not of the 1-year results which are going to be presented first from that trial but the 5-year results which will give us a sense of whether this really makes a difference for patients especially patients who are not in the extreme elderly group who may expect to live for 5-10 years‚Äù he clarified. ‚ÄúWe need that desperately to really know what is best for that challenging group because the PPM rates here are not trivial.‚Äù

In agreement panelist Anita Asgar MD (Montreal Heart Institute Canada) said all of these data will become increasingly important as TAVI moves into lower-risk patients. ‚ÄúHemodynamics we maybe didn't ignore but it wasn't perhaps as much of an issue in the elderly population‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAnd now with younger patients we need to take all these things into consideration.‚Äù

What will also be important is ‚Äúunderstanding how these hemodynamics vary under exercise and stress‚Äù she added.

Session co-moderator Jane Leopold MD (Brigham and Women‚Äôs Hospital Boston MA) reiterated this point saying: ‚ÄúExercise hemodynamics [are] incredibly important because the hemodynamics at rest just don't predict what the patient does when the patient gets up and walks out from the hospital.‚Äù

Name: Electronic Arts
Name_1: The Sims 4 will be free-to-play from October
Text_1:
Released in September 2014 The Sims 4 is a life simulation game that focuses on character creation development and housebuilding. And on Wednesday the game publisher Electronic Arts (EA) announced that the base version of the game would go free to play next month.

Starting October 18 the social simulation game will be available for download for free on the PlayStation 4 PlayStation 5 Windows PC Xbox Series X Xbox One and Mac. Those who have already purchased the game will be getting the upcoming Desert Luxe Kit for free. In case you didn‚Äôt know the new kit adds furniture items based on the natural landscape of the desert.

Name_3: FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Guide
Text_3:
With the Summer Transfer Window in full swing EA finally released an event that focuses on the latest happenings in World Football and it‚Äôs not Preseason! After a long and draining Summer Vacation: Europe event FIFA Mobile 22 brings the Kickoff Rivalries event to celebrate the beginning of a new season and revisiting some of the old domestic rivalries across top football leagues from the world!

It‚Äôs time to dust off your cleats and prepare for Kickoff Rivalries! It‚Äôs an event that focuses on some of the most famous rivalries and summer transfers. Play Rivalry Matchups and sign new Kickoff Transfer Players. New Leagues unlock weekly so there is a little something for everyone.

FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Event Description

Event Duration: 25 August ‚Äì 6 October (42 days)

FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Event Flow

Main

In the Main Tab you will play a series of three Skill Games and one of four Matches Daily to earn League-Specific Points Rivalries Tickets Rivalries Tokens and Transfer Tokens every day. Start off by heading over to the Kickoff Rivalries through Live Events. Each Match will have a different lineup requirement that is based on that week‚Äôs League.

FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Main Chapter (Image via Electronic Arts)

The requirement includes having three Players from a specific club or League. So the lineup requirements change from week to week but it stays either from that club or league. Based on the lineup requirements there are additional match difficulties but there is no advantage in doing the harder difficulties as the rewards given are the same across all the matches.

Choose one Match to complete per day all other Matches will be locked after completion. Earn League Points Rivalries Tickets Rivalries Tokens and Transfer Tokens by completing the daily Skill Games and Match. It‚Äôs a six-week-long event with each week we have a different league unlocking like the Team of the Season (TOTS) with a hell lot of event currencies.

Kickoff Rivalries Matchups

In the Kickoff Rivalries Matchups tab you can grind for event currencies mainly League-Specific Points and Retro Kits. This Chapter contains some of the most well-known rivalries in football! Each week a new League unlocks with epic derbies for you to play with new Matches daily.

FIFA Mobile Kickoff Rivalries Matchups (Image via Electronic Arts)

Now all the matches you see here are similar to League Matchups from last season‚Äôs FIFA Mobile 21 but with a twist. You will play with your own default team with an AI of the opposite rival team. Two matchups unlock daily and you will want to complete them all for the League-Specific Points and Retro Kits. Earn 1000 League Points per Match and progress towards the milestones. Earn some amazing Retro Kits by completing the milestones!

Kickoff Rivalries League Rewards

Moving on to the actual league‚Äôs tab it‚Äôs just a path of rewards you run down. As the paths go we have players running incrementally from 92 to all the way 98. This is a rehash of what we have seen the entire season long in big major events. The players are fantastic their stats are stellar. These are endgame players mostly and are all starters.

FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Reward Path (Image via Electronic Arts)

So much like Team of the Season (TOTS) the event has both Tickets and Points. So it might actually be better for you to hold off your Tickets for one path and go all-in on it. Spend your League Points for rewards such as Rivalries Tickets Transfer Tokens Skill Boosts Coins Base Players and Rivalries Players! Exchange your Rivalries Tickets in these Chapters for League Points. Needless to say every Featured League will have its own chapter.

Additionally You can convert your Rivalries Tickets to the particular League Point of your choice. The conversion rate is at a 1:1 ratio for each and every Ticket. You can keep your Rivalries Tickets until your preferred League unlocks. Additionally there are league-specific milestones which give you extra Rivalries Tickets a 97 OVR Enhanced Base Icon and a P2W 105 OVR Prime Icon on spending league-specific points. Spending your League Points gives you the progression towards the milestones.

Kickoff Transfer

Kickoff Transfer is where you trade in your Transfer Tokens in exchange for the Player Wheel. This is the exact same Player Wheel that we have seen in events of the past where you are guaranteed a player on every 10 turns along with Pinnacle Points. Kickoff Transfer is where you‚Äôll find Players that have recently transferred to a new club. Spend Transfer Tokens to earn Rivalries Players and resources.

FIFA Mobile Kickoff Rivalries Wheel (Image via Electronic Arts)

The Players reset weekly so watch out if you are looking around for a new player. Claim the offer 10 times to guarantee to claim a Transfer Player on your next claim. Keep in mind that claiming a Transfer Player resets your progress towards a guaranteed Player. New Transfer Players and your progress reset weekly.

Claiming the Transfer Player rewards you with a bonus of 50 Pinnacle Points. The Pinnacle Points are used to claim 102+ OVR Pinnacle Transfers Players in the Pinnacle Transfer Chapter. There is an additional path of Milestone of rewards here as well. Earn Milestone progress by spending your Transfer Tokens and claim rewards! Remember the players update weekly but not the milestones.

Kickoff Rivalries Offers

This is a little tab on the side where we get the exclusive daily Rivalries Offers and Exchanges. Spend your Rivalries Tokens to earn Rivalries Players Base Players and resources. Complete Exchanges to earn Rivalries Players League Points and Pinnacle Points.

FIFA Mobile Rivalries Kickoffs Exchanges (Image via Electronic Arts)

This is a sort of Player and Resource Exchange offer where you can exchange Rivalries Players for Pinnacle Points League-Specific Points and Rivalries Players. The Pinnacle Points exchanges reset weekly while the League-Specific Points reset daily. While the Pinnacle Points exchanges are a little expensive you can get a ton of them just from these exchanges!

Star Pass

Obviously there are Passes as well Free Passes and Paid Passes. The big pass is the Star Pass which is loaded with a ton of rewards. Complete Quests throughout the event to earn Star Pass progress which includes rewards like Rivalries Tokens Rivalries Tickets Transfer Players Base Players a 99 OVR Enhanced Base Icon and a 103 OVR Event Icon!

FIFA Mobile Kickoff Rivalries Star Pass (Image via Electronic Arts)

Play Division Rivals Matches and complete daily/weekly Quests to progress. This Star Pass is massive lasting 42 days and looks like this time it‚Äôs worth the money. There are Points and Tokens both on the pay side and the free side with the players being only exclusive for the paid version of the pass. With what rewards it gives out it can be a bargain as yes a 99 and 103 OVR Event Icon is up for grabs.

So don‚Äôt forget your daily quests to progress through the Star Pass! Earning Star Pass Credits will unlock more rewards along the Star Pass path. There are two tiers to the Star Pass: free and premium. You can also use FIFA Points to move faster through Star Pass levels and collect rewards faster.

FIFA Mobile Kickoff Rivalries League Pass (Image via Electronic Arts)

In addition to the Star Pass there are six different League Passes that unlock as the league they represent goes live. These passes will stay for the remainder of the event and the Paid Pass requires 1000 FIFA Points. You gain progress for all active League Passes by completing the Daily Kickoff Rivalries Quests and claiming the Rivalries Pass Credits. Gain progress through the League Pass and earn League-Specific Points Transfer Tokens Rivalries Tickets 93-98 OVR Kickoff Rivalries Players Coins Skill Boosts and Rank Items.

Kickoff Rivalries Exchanges

There are Exchanges in the event as well. Each week as a different league unlocks you will have three different Kickoff Rivalries league-specific Exchanges. During Kickoff Rivalries we will have a variety of Exchanges available let‚Äôs continue to see what‚Äôs on offer! Trade-in 92+ OVR League Rivalries Player in League Specific Exchanges for Kickoff Rivalries league-specific Points.

FIFA Mobile Kickoff Rivalries Exchanges (Image via Electronic Arts)

Obviously The League Exchanges will only be available for one week after the League unlocks. Additionally you can trade in Golds and 80-85+ OVR Elite Players for Transfer Tokens Rivalries Tickets and Rivalries Tokens. Keep an eye out for weekly 98 OVR and 100 OVR Exchange Players throughout the event!

Pinnacle Transfers

Pinnacle Transfers contains some of the highest OVR Players that are currently available in the game. They can be termed as the Ultimate TOTS or the UTOTS of this event. The difference is they won‚Äôt be a Higher-OVR version of the existing players from the event instead they will be the biggest names that make moves in the recent Summer Transfer Window

FIFA Mobile Kickoff Rivalries Pinnacle Transfers (Image via Electronic Arts)

By claiming Players from the Kickoff Rivalries Reward Path you will earn Pinnacle Points. You will also earn additionally every time you get a player from the Kickoff Transfer Wheel and the Offer Exchanges. The Pinnacle Players start from 102 OVR with each requiring a minimum of 850 Pinnacle Points. Pinnacle Transfers will be open for the last two weeks of the event. So remember to do your Exchanges and focus on Pinnacle Points!

FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Event Currencies

League Points

Earn them from daily Skill Games and Matches Exchanges and League Passes

and and Spend them in the League Rewards Chapters for rewards and Players

Rivalries Tickets

Earn them from daily Skill Games  Matches and Exchanges

 and Trade in your Rivalries Tickets for League Points

Rivalries Tokens

Earn them from a daily Skill Game and Exchanges

and Spent in Kickoff Rivalries Offer for Rewards and Players



Transfer Tokens

Earn from a daily Skill Game and Exchanges

and Spend them in Kickoff Transfer to claim Transfer Players and Pinnacle Points or use them in the Exchanges

Pinnacle Points

Earn them by claiming Transfer Players from the Kickoff Transfer Chapter

from the Spend them in the Pinnacle Transfers Chapter to claim 102+ OVR Pinnacle Players

Rivalries Pass Credits

Earn them by completing Quests

Use them to progress through the League Passes

Running the Math for F2P Players

As per our calculations the following sums up the chances for F2P Players. This time it is going to be a little different for the League-specific Points-wise breakdown as you can‚Äôt get the same amount of League-Specific points across all leagues like TOTS.

Resource Management

Rivalries Tickets Transfer Tokens EPL League-Specific Points Rivalries Tokens Main Skill Games 39900 2100 11900 1050 Free Star Pass 8150 725 425 Free League Pass 7500 900 2200 Daily Ads 6300 1050 630 Daily Claim 1800 1200 Exchanges 7500 3000 1000 Reward Path Milestones 30000 Kickoff Rivalries Matchups 14000 Kickoff Rivalries Offers 126000 Transfer Path Milestones 1900 100 Kickoff Rivalries Quests 3000 300 3500 300 Premium Star Pass 40750 2250 6600 1275 Premium Paid Pass 22500 2700 Total 106050~169300 9275~14225 157600~164200 3505~4780 Credits: FIFA Mobile Forum Twitter

Additionally you can get more Rivalries Tickets from the Kickoff Rivalries League Rewards chapter that varies on how much you progress in your respective league-specific paths. Keeping that in mind we have not factored in that amount which is definitely not less for our calculation of total Rivalries Tickets.

You can get at least a minimum of 106050 Rivalries Tickets and 9275 Rivalries Tokens from the event.

Once again your Points solely depend on how much you choose to spend on the exchanges. Additionally note that since the League-Specific Points rotate across the skill games the Kickoff Rivalries Offer Exchanges remain for the League even after they complete their weekly rotation. Yes you do get your Rivalries Offer Exchanges daily for every league once they start in their skill games rotation. This brings the total points across all leagues being free-to-play to:

Leagues Kickoff Rivalries Exchange Offers Total League-Specific Points Premier League 126000 157600~164200 Bundesliga 105000 136600~143200 Ligue 1 84000 115600~122200 La Liga 63000 94600~101200 Serie A 42000 73600~80200 Rest of the World 21000 52600~59200 Credits: Luixen Twitter

So as soon as a new league opens up it gets its own Kickoff Rivalries Exchange Offers that refresh daily and stays till the end of the event. Additionally the above points tally is just the total without factoring the additional League-Specific Points you can get from the various Trade-Ins for trading Rivalries Tickets on a 1:1 Ratio.

You can get the maximum number of League-Specific Points for the Premier League (EPL)

Remember at the end of the day all your gains and losses from this event come down to how much you focus on the Exchanges be it for the League-Specific Points or the Pinnacle Points. So if you have earned a lot of coins from past events and have a stockpile of players should have it easy in the Kickoff Rivalries.

We usually never suggest buying the Star Pass but if you were able to spend your $10 on the game even once this is the time when it is definitely worth it. The Pass does appear to be worth it and will make the difference between what you can claim and what you can‚Äôt from the final Pinnacle Players.

FIFA Mobile 22 Kickoff Rivalries Event Tips and Tricks

After a long and exciting Summer Vacation: Europe Kickoff Rivalries is another massive and rewarding event in FIFA Mobile 22. It has a little amount of grind with daily skill games and a hell of a lot of event currencies. So here are our additional tips and tricks to help you get the best from the event. It took us a while to get these answers and calculate everything so let‚Äôs explain it here.

Now tips for the event. Play everything. Be excited that there‚Äôs no event energy or stamina involved anymore in the new season. We‚Äôre not dealing with the constant fear of energy getting wasted and full and neither has there been a single ad since the game was released. So yes definitely enjoy it while you can.

Kickoff Rivalries League Rewards

It‚Äôs going to come down to what players you want and what individual league is most important to you for your team. As far as grabbing the players for selling the higher the rate of the player the more he is going to be worth it. Therefore it‚Äôs just going to be getting who you need for your team and buying the rest.

Player OVR Main Path Cost Side Path Cost Total Path Cost 92 OVR 4100 12000 16100 95 OVR 16200 27000 43200 98 OVR 53950 50000 103950 102 OVR 165950 104000 269950 97 OVR Enhanced Base Icon 50000 105 OVR Prime Icon 425000 Credits: FIFA Mobile Forum Twitter

From the table above you can clearly see you can go down straight down the path and easily grab at least one of the 98 OVR Kickoff Rivalries Players from the first four leagues without even relying on the Rivalries Tickets. Do keep in mind this you will need to do the Kickoff Rivalries Offers Exchanges daily and religiously without missing a single day.

We will still suggest you horde in and save your Rivalries Tickets till the very end as the remaining leagues unlock and then finally make your decision. While going for your favorite players from a particular league might be your initial plan going for the maximum Pinncale Points can help you in the long run. Keeping everything in mind here is our strategy on how to maximize your gains.

Play through the event just remember to log in and play through each and everything. Play all possible Skill games Matches and Quests. Try to maximize your points from the Exchanges as many times as you can. For the special Matchups try to complete them weekly as they help in giving out extra League-Specific Points which will create a difference in the end. There a free-to-play player can claim

Focusing on the 102 OVR Players

102 OVR Player from the Premier League ( All Tickets Trade-In )

from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Bundesliga

and from the 2x 98 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Ligue 1

and from the 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the La Liga

and from the 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Serie A

and from the 2x 95 OVR Players from the Rest of the World

The above calculation stands only valid if you focus to do on the daily League-Specific Offer Exchanges and trade in all of your Rivalries Tickets for Premier League Points.

You can get either of the 102 OVR Players (ƒ∞lkay G√ºndoƒüan/Harry Kane) from the Premier League 4x 98 OVR Players from the Bundesliga and Ligue 1 and 900 Pinnacle Points if you complete all the Exchanges and Trade-Ins in EPL

Focusing on the 98 OVR Players

2x 98 OVR  2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Premier League ( 17350 Tickets Trade-In )

 and from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR  2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Bundesliga ( 38350 Tickets Trade-In )

 and from the ( ) 1x 98 OVR  2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Ligue 1 ( 39350 Tickets Trade-In )

from the ( ) 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the La Liga ( No Exchanges Required )

and from the ( ) 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Serie A ( No Exchanges Required )

and from the ( ) 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Rest of the World (15000 Tickets Trade-In)

You can get a total of 5x 98 OVR Players and 1275 Pinnacle Points if you complete all the above-mentioned Exchanges and Trade-Ins

If you follow the above path you will need to vary how you spend the Rivalries Tickets across the six leagues. There is another alternative track on how to obtain the 98 OVR Players across the various leagues and in the end it comes down to you on how you want to choose your path:

2x 98 OVR  2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Premier League ( 17400 Tickets Trade-In )

 and from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Bundesliga ( No Exchanges Required )

and from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR Players from the Ligue 1 ( 2400 Tickets Trade-In )

You can get a total of 5x 98 OVR Players and 1100 Pinnacle Points if you complete all the above-mentioned Exchanges and Trade-Ins

Focusing on the 102 OVR Players (with Star Pass)

102 OVR Player from the Premier League ( 106350 Tickets Trade-In )

( ) 2x 98 OVR and 2x 95 OVR Players from the Bundesliga ( 20350 Tickets Trade-In )

and from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR Players from the Ligue 1 ( 2350 Tickets Trade-In )

from the ( ) 1x 98 OVR Player from the La Liga ( 3350 Tickets Trade-In )

and from the ( ) 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Rest of the World (14600 Tickets Trade-In)

You can get either of the 102 OVR Players (ƒ∞lkay G√ºndoƒüan/Harry Kane) from the Premier League 5x 98 OVR Players from the Bundesliga Ligue 1 and La Liga and 875 Pinnacle Points if you complete all the above-mentioned Exchanges and Trade-Ins

If you follow the above path you will need to vary how you spend the Rivalries Tickets across the six leagues with the additional caveat of having the extra Rivalries Tickets from Star Pass in your inventory.

Focusing on the 102 OVR Players (with Star Pass and all the 6 League Passes)

There is another alternative track on how to obtain both the 102 OVR Players from the Premier League but involves all the six individual League Passes as well and in the end it comes down to you on how you want to choose your path:

2x 102 OVR Player s from the Premier League ( 139750 Tickets Trade-In )

( ) 2x 98 OVR and 2x 95 OVR Players from the Bundesliga ( 13750 Tickets Trade-In )

and from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR Players from the Ligue 1 ( No Exchanges Required )

from the ( ) 2x 98 OVR Player from the La Liga ( 16750 Tickets Trade-In )

from the ( ) 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Serie A ( No Exchanges Required )

and from the ( ) 2x 95 OVR and 2x 92 OVR Players from the Rest of the World (8000 Tickets Trade-In)

You can get both the 102 OVR Players (ƒ∞lkay G√ºndoƒüan/Harry Kane) from the Premier League 6x 98 OVR Players from the Bundesliga Ligue 1 and La Liga and 1050 Pinnacle Points if you complete all the above-mentioned Exchanges and Trade-Ins

Please remember we are not encouraging anyone to spend their hard-earned cash on the game and buy the Star Pass. It is completely one‚Äôs choice whether they want to spend on the game or not. But still if you were saving to buy the Star Pass for once this is the time. This is seriously the one time buying and completing the Star Pass can give you an additional boost that might be worth it. The Star Pass also rewards you with 103 OVR Event Icons LB Roberto Carlos.

Maximizing Pinnacle Points

Pinnacle Points is this event‚Äôs Ultimate and going after maximizing the Pinnacle Points might just be the best way to go. But for that remember there are lots and lots of Exchanges so if you want to maximize Pinnacle Points don‚Äôt rule out going for any Exchanges.

Now in order to complete the maximum Kickoff Rivalries Offer Exchanges you need a stockpile of 89 OVRs on your team. If you have been watching the market and buying cards using your coins then this should be a smooth transition.

FIFA Mobile League-Specific Exchanges (Image via Electronic Arts)

To be precise you are looking at a grand total of 294x 89 OVRs to complete all of the exchanges. And if you want to stay free-to-play without buying any of the League Passes or the Star Pass then just go for all the Exchanges!

On completing all the exchanges your numbers bump up drastically you can actually get both the 92 OVRS from all the six leagues both the 95 OVRs from all the six leagues and both the 98 OVRs from 3-4 leagues given how you proceed with your Tickets and Star Pass. Additionally with the Milestone Rewards rewarding extra Rivalries Tickets as you claim the players you won‚Äôt even need all the 294x 89 OVRs to gather the points! Therefore you can claim:

12x 92 OVR Players across six leagues

across 12x 95 OVR Players across six leagues

across 6x 98 OVR Players across the first three leagues

You can get a total of 6x 98 OVR Players and a massive 1350 Pinnacle Points being free-to-play if you complete all the Exchanges and Trade-Ins

Additionally you can obtain more Pinnacle Points from the weekly Kickoff Rivalries Offer Exchanges. You need a total of 4x 92+ OVR Players from the Reward Path per week you can get them from the market to obtain 200 Pinnacle Points per week from the exchanges. They grow exponentially as new leagues unlock with the previous exchanges remaining throughout the leagues.

Therefore if you complete all the Pinnacle Points exchanges every week you will stack up a total of 4200 Pinnacle Points just from the exchanges alone!

In fact that is not all on the Kickoff Transfer Wheel we are guaranteed 50 Pinnacle Points on every 10th pull along with a Kickoff Transfer Player. With free-to-players having guaranteed 30 pulls a further 150 Pinnacle Points is also up for grabs taking the total to:

1350 Pinnacle Points from Player Rewards

from 4200 Pinnacle Points from the Pinnacle Points Exchanges

from the 150 Pinnacle Points from the Kickoff Transfer Wheel

You can get a maximum total of 5700 Pinnacle Points being free-to-play if you complete all the exchanges

Keep in mind that you might need to do the Unlimited League-Specific Points exchanges at least 10-15 times to obtain the above goal.

Maximizing Pinnacle Points (with Star Pass)

Combining the Star Pass with the above calculations you can only slightly improve your gains from the Pinnacle Points. Here the advantage is since you obtain a lot of Rivalries Tickets you can relax from completing the Rivalries Offer Exchanges for League-Specific Points. This can lead you to a total Pinnacle Points of:

12x 92 OVR Players across six leagues

across 12x 95 OVR Players across six leagues

across 7x 98 OVR Players across the first four leagues

You can get a total of 7x 98 OVR Players and a massive 1425 Pinnacle Points being free-to-play if you complete all the Exchanges and Trade-Ins

Your Exchanges for the Pinnacle Points remain the same rewarding with 4200 Pinnacle Points despite the Star Pass while you gain an additional 10 pulls from the Kickoff Transfer Wheel guaranteeing a further 200 Pinnacle Points taking the total to:

1425 Pinnacle Points from Player Rewards

from 4200 Pinnacle Points from the Pinnacle Points Exchanges

from the 200 Pinnacle Points from the Kickoff Transfer Wheel

You can get a maximum total of 5825 Pinnacle Points being free-to-play if you complete all the exchanges

Keep in mind that you might need to do the Unlimited League-Specific Points exchanges at least 20-22 times to obtain the above goal.

Maximizing Pinnacle Points (with Star Pass and all the 6 League Passes)

Combining the Star Pass and all the six different League Passes with the above calculations you can only slightly improve your gains from the Pinnacle Points. Here the advantage is since you obtain extra League-Specific Points you can relax from completing the Unlimited Exchanges for League-Specific Points. This can lead you to a total Pinnacle Points of:

12x 92 OVR Players across six leagues

Thus you can see buying the Star Pass and all the League-Specific Passes only increases your Pinnacle Points by a small number. Although if you choose to focus on getting both the 102 OVRs and quite a few 98s then Star Pass can be a viable option for you. Name: EQT
Name_1: Three transformative years for Melita
Text_1:
In 2019 EQT Infrastructure part of the global private investment firm EQT headquartered in Sweden acquired Melita Limited. The company is now leading the way in developing Malta‚Äôs digital infrastructure and the provision of best-in-class communication services.

Three years on Ulrich K√∂llensperger partner at EQT Infrastructure and Melita advisory board member reflects on the motivations behind the acquisition developments at Melita since and the company‚Äôs plans for the future.

‚ÄùEQT is very clear about its approach to investing in companies around the world. We have a track record of nearly three decades of acquiring good companies and actively helping them to become great and sustainable. This is exactly the approach we are taking with Melita and the results have been impressive‚Äù K√∂llensperger said.

Speaking about EQT‚Äôs decision to buy Melita back in 2019 K√∂llensperger said: ‚ÄúIn the 1990s Melita was a pioneer in delivering cable TV to Malta establishing itself as a leading domestic brand in what has become one of the most digitally connected countries in Europe. 2016 saw the arrival of Harald R√∂sch who has been CEO since.

‚ÄúUnder Harald‚Äôs leadership Melita has transformed itself focusing on customer service and upgrading its network. By 2019 significant progress had been made and we at EQT decided to invest in Melita as it had proved itself to be a good company with significant further development potential. We were also drawn to Malta as a country with its impressive track record of economic growth and development low unemployment rate significant tourism industry and a highly advanced communications and digital environment.‚Äù

When asked to highlight how EQT has helped Melita‚Äôs achievements over the past three years R√∂sch said: ‚ÄúA key area of growth has been the business segment where Melita Business is now serving many large and small enterprises backed by the services offered at Malta‚Äôs largest and only purpose-built data centre. Melita has also joined forces with a number of companies that provide complimentary services transforming it into an ideal one-stop-shop for all business connectivity requirements.

Under Harald‚Äôs [R√∂sch] leadership Melita has transformed itself focusing on customer service and upgrading its network

‚ÄúFrom a customer service perspective Melita has continued to improve. Independent customer research shows that Melita‚Äôs customers have a very high level of satisfaction when measured against international benchmarks. The fixed and mobile network is also world class. Melita continues to be one of the very few operators worldwide and the only one in Europe able to offer a 5G mobile network and a gigabit fibre-powered broadband service nationwide. This focus on combining top class customer service with strong infrastructure has served Melita well enabling it to add both retail and business customers.‚Äù

He added: ‚ÄúMelita has not only improved its performance over the past three years. It has also become increasingly focused on sustainability catering to EQT‚Äôs strategic target of making a positive impact through every investment. This year Melita became the first EQT portfolio company to have its science-based targets validated by the Science Based Targets Initiative.

‚ÄúThis collaboration between the United Nations Global Compact CDP World Resources Institute (WRI) and the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) is designed to drive ambitious climate action in the private sector.

‚ÄúOur efforts to become sustainable are also having a direct impact on our financial position. In fact we have recently been able to convert an existing ‚Ç¨20 million revolving credit facility into a sustainability-linked credit facility. This means that the interest rate charged by lenders on this facility will be reduced subject to Melita reaching specific sustainability targets.

‚ÄúThis commitment to sustainability is matched by efforts to support the community; the Melita Foundation has invested ‚Ç¨500000 into the development of digital skills the environment and Malta‚Äôs heritage.‚Äù

Looking ahead EQT will continue supporting Melita in its ambitious plans for growth. K√∂llensperger provided further insight on the roadmap ahead.

‚ÄúMelita‚Äôs digital infrastructure is a cornerstone of its competitive advantage and one which will be strengthened by continuously investing to drive fibre deeper into the fixed network. The 5G mobile and gigabit fibre- powered internet networks will remain vital in attracting foreign investment to Malta while creating the opportunity to develop new services he said.

‚ÄúA clear example is melita.io which offers nationwide 5G Narrowband Internet-of-Things (NB-IoT) and LoRaWAN networks. Thanks to its broad set of roaming agreements international partners and experience melita.io has taken its IoT connectivity offering internationally. Building on the company‚Äôs strong IoT and fibre offerings is a key focus of Melita‚Äôs innovation and growth for EQT in the coming years.

‚ÄúAt Melita we have a great team which has embraced our ambition to make Melita a great company; both in the products and services it delivers to customers and its impact on the wider community. While there‚Äôs always more to do everyone at Melita can be proud of how far they have come and excited about what the future holds.‚Äù

More information about EQT can be found at www.eqtgroup.com.

Name: Equity Residential
Name_1: The housing mess explained
Text_1:
A version of this story appeared in CNN‚Äôs What Matters newsletter. To get it in your inbox sign up for free here.

CNN ‚Äî

Home owners renters and potential buyers look at housing and the real estate market from different often conflicting perspectives.

There are alarming headlines for all three in recent weeks:

This convergence speaks to the larger problem of a shortage of affordable housing in the US as well as the broad issue of affordability and leads to stories like this: Majority of Americans say they‚Äôre worried about being able to pay for housing.

I went to Anna Bahney the CNN Business writer focused on real estate to understand why there‚Äôs a housing shortage and what if anything anyone is doing about it.

Our conversation conducted by email is below.

A housing shortage an affordability crisis

WHAT MATTERS: I have read both that there‚Äôs a housing shortage and that there‚Äôs a housing crisis. Is there a difference between those ideas ‚Äì a shortage and a crisis? And is the problem that there literally aren‚Äôt enough houses for the number of people in the US?

BAHNEY: The ‚Äúhousing crisis‚Äù is actually an ‚Äúaffordability crisis.‚Äù Part of the reason housing has become so expensive for Americans is because there is a national shortage of homes. Record low interest rates during the pandemic coupled with more than a decade of under building created a supply and demand mismatch that has pushed home prices higher.

The US has fallen behind by about 5.5 million housing units over the past 20 years as builders failed to keep up with historical building trends. If you add in property destruction due to demolition or natural disasters among other things the total shortfall could be 6.8 million during that time according to the National Association of Realtors.

This is a gap so deep that it would take more than a decade to catch up. But even if more homes and apartments are built it won‚Äôt matter unless people can afford them.

Mortgage rates are the highest they have been since 2008 and home prices remain near record highs pricing many prospective homebuyers out of the market. Those people then remain in the already tight rental market pushing rents up even further.

As tenants reach the limits of what they can afford to pay each month homeownership gets further out of reach as they struggle to save for a down payment. This widens the wealth gap and locks in place inequities between those who benefit financially from homeownership and those who don‚Äôt. It also widens the racial home ownership gap in which 72% of White Americans are homeowners while only 43% of Black Americans own a home.

The cost of housing is driving inflation

WHAT MATTERS: The cost of housing has been cited as a cause of inflation. To what extent is that true and what is the market force that could lower the cost of housing?

BAHNEY: The soaring cost of housing has been a key driver of inflation. For most people housing is their biggest expense. About one-third of the Consumer Price Index a basket of goods and services the Bureau of Labor Statistics uses to track inflation is the ‚Äúshelter‚Äù component.

Last month the index showed that inflation was worse than expected and the housing component had risen 6.2% from a year ago the biggest increase since 1991. Stubbornly high inflation means that the Federal Reserve will likely take aggressive action at its meeting next week with either a 75 basis-point hike in interest rates or potentially a 100 basis-point hike.

But there are some early signs of cooling in the housing market. Home sales have been dropping for six months in a row as the rising cost to buy and finance a home pushes more people out of the housing market. As demand dries up prices will come down and eventually mortgage rates will settle.

Where is the housing shortage felt the worst?

WHAT MATTERS: Which parts of the country are most affected by this problem?

BAHNEY: Cities in the Sun Belt like Phoenix and Austin saw some of the biggest increases in housing costs during the pandemic. In Miami the price of a home is up 33% from a year ago and rents are up 26% from last year. But the affordability crisis is happening nationally in all regions of the country.

The median-priced house now costs $749 more per month

WHAT MATTERS: The Fed‚Äôs medicine for inflation is to raise interest rates which has driven up mortgage rates. That might control sales prices but won‚Äôt it make the cost of housing more expensive?

BAHNEY: The Federal Reserve has been aggressively raising interest rates in order to stem inflation which may reduce demand but also makes the cost of buying a home even more expensive.

But the Fed doesn‚Äôt set the rate borrowers pay on mortgages directly. Instead mortgage rates tend to track the yield on the 10-year US Treasury. As investors anticipate the Fed‚Äôs rate hikes they often sell government bonds which sends yields higher and with it mortgage rates.

The rate on a typical 30-year-fixed mortgage has more than doubled from a year ago making a home purchase that was possible then out of reach for some today.

A year ago a buyer who put 20% down on a median priced $359900 home and financed the rest with a mortgage rate of 2.86% ‚Äì which was the average at the time ‚Äì had a monthly payment of $1192.

Today a homeowner buying the median priced home which is now $403800 with a mortgage at the current average of 6.02% would pay $1941 a month in principal and interest. That‚Äôs $749 more every month.

Americans are now spending more than 35% of their median income on monthly principal and interest payments on that median-priced home. Historically Americans spent closer to 25% of their median income on payments.

To get back to that level some combination of these things would need to happen according to mortgage data company Black Knight: a person‚Äôs income would need to grow by 40% mortgage rates would have to be cut in half or there would need to be a 30% drop in the median price of a house.

None of those are likely to happen any time soon.

Homeownership is getting out of reach

WHAT MATTERS: If housing prices go down it will mean millions of people lose value in their main asset. If housing prices don‚Äôt go down it means millions of Americans will never own a home. It seems like an impossible situation.

BAHNEY: Some housing economists have been saying lately that the housing industry is in a recession but homeowners aren‚Äôt feeling that way. Sure there are plenty of examples of cooling in the housing industry (mortgage firm layoffs home builders pulling back home sales falling). But homeowners still have tremendous equity in their homes which has risen by an average of $60000 in the past year.

Still millions of people are being shut out of homebuying as the affordability challenges prove insurmountable.

In April 2021 a household had to earn about $80000 a year to afford payments on the median-priced home with a modest down payment of 3.5%. A year later the income requirement was $108000. This cost increase means that about 4 million renter households that could have bought the median-priced home last year could no longer do so 12 months later.

How can this problem be fixed?

WHAT MATTERS: What are some of the ideas to fix this problem? Is there an effective way the government can act?

BAHNEY: Most housing policy experts say that building a steady supply of new moderately priced homes is job number one. But because those homes are not as profitable for builders as larger higher-priced homes it will take a concerted effort by both public and private sectors.

In May the Biden administration announced a Housing Supply Action Plan to close the affordability gap and ease housing costs. The plan aims to boost the supply of affordable housing by enhancing existing federal financing and incentivizing areas to reform zoning and land use policies to build more lower-cost housing. It also calls for homebuilders to adopt more efficient construction methods.

But none of this is a quick fix and some of it requires congressional action.

Separately the Federal Housing Finance Administration which oversees mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac has announced plans this summer to expand home financing options for buyers particularly those of color to close the racial homeownership gap. These programs include down payment assistance lower mortgage insurance premiums and a credit reporting system that factors in rent payment history.

Some of these ideas including new zero down payment loans with no closing costs for buyers in specific Black or Hispanic neighborhoods are already in place.
